title: Business Credit & Operations Virtual Assistant
description:
I am seeking a highly organized, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant with experience in business setup, business credit building, and financial operations support. You will execute a structured, time-sensitive plan to establish, optimize, and monitor multiple business entities for credibility, vendor credit, and lender readiness.



This role requires precision, documentation, follow-through, and the ability to work with financial institutions, business directories, and credit bureaus. You must be comfortable following a playbook and tracking progress in a shared workspace.



Required Skills

	•	Business credit building experience (DUNS, Paydex, tradelines, NAV, eCredable)

	•	Business formation/compliance knowledge (LLCs, Registered Agent, SOS status)

	•	Experience setting up business phone systems and securing 411/directory listings

	•	Familiarity with business credit bureaus (Dun & Bradstreet, Experian Business, Equifax Business)

	•	Strong Google Sheets/Excel skills (tracking ADB, deposits, tasks, and documentation)

	•	High attention to detail and accuracy with matching data across multiple platforms

	•	Project/task management experience (ClickUp, Notion, Trello, or Asana)

	•	Comfort working with financial data and bank accounts (view-only access)

	•	Reliable communication & deadline management in a remote setting

title: Shopify Website Designer & Developer (5+ Years Experience Required)
description:
Project Overview



We are looking for a highly experienced Shopify designer and developer to completely redesign and optimize an existing Shopify store for better branding, user experience, and higher conversion rates.



The website is already built. This is NOT a basic setup job.



We need a professional who can elevate the brand visually, improve conversion performance, optimize technical performance, and customize the store beyond template limitations.



This role is for someone who understands premium e-commerce execution, not basic theme editing.

Project Scope (Phase 1 – Redesign & Optimization)



Audit & Strategy

* Full UX/UI audit of the current Shopify store

* Identify conversion bottlenecks

* Competitive analysis (experience in jewelry or premium e-commerce preferred)

* Provide a clear improvement roadmap



Design & Branding

* Modern, high-converting homepage redesign

* Improved layout structure and visual hierarchy

* Premium product page redesign focused on trust-building

* Clean typography and spacing improvements

* Custom banners and section designs

* Strong brand consistency



Technical Optimization

* Website speed optimization (Core Web Vitals)

* Mobile-first optimization

* Fix bugs, broken links, and layout issues

* Improve navigation and overall shopping flow

* Improve checkout experience

* Implement SEO best practices and structured data



Custom Development

* Advanced Shopify Liquid customization

* Custom sections beyond theme defaults

* UX-enhancing micro-interactions

* App integration and optimization

* Code cleanup and performance tuning



Performance Goals

* Improve conversion rate

* Improve mobile usability

* Reduce bounce rate

* Improve page load speed

* Strengthen brand trust perception



Requirements (Strict)

* Minimum 5+ years professional Shopify experience (non-negotiable)

* Strong portfolio of premium Shopify stores

* Advanced Shopify Liquid, HTML, CSS, JavaScript

* Proven experience improving conversion rates

* Strong understanding of CRO principles

* Experience optimizing page speed

* Strong UI/UX design ability (not just coding)

* Ability to create custom layouts, not only theme editing

* Experience with SEO and structured data

* Ability to work independently with minimal supervision

* Strong communication skills



Applications without a strong Shopify portfolio will not be considered.



Bonus (Highly Preferred)

* Experience in jewelry or luxury e-commerce

* Graphic design skills (banners, promotional creatives)

* Experience with multi-channel integration (Shopify + Etsy + eBay + Amazon)

* A/B testing experience

* Analytics setup experience (GA4, Meta Pixel, etc.)



Work Monitoring & Expectations



* Clear milestone-based delivery

* Weekly progress reporting required

* All work will be reviewed and monitored

* Code must be clean, documented, and optimized

* No shortcut or low-quality bulk solutions

* High attention to detail is mandatory



We are looking for a long-term professional partner, not a short-term freelancer.

title: Social Media and Marketing VA
description:
About the Role

Worker Bees LLC is hiring a Social Media & Marketing Virtual Assistant for our client Upstaxx — an AI-powered tax savings platform that helps Americans find every credit, deduction, and strategy they’re missing.



Upstaxx is in beta and growing fast. They need a creative, data-driven marketing VA who can build their social media presence across ALL platforms and generate real leads.



This is NOT a “just post pretty graphics” role. We need someone who understands content strategy, audience growth, engagement, and lead generation. If you can turn social media followers into paying users, this role is for you.



What You’ll Be Doing

Social Media Management (All Platforms)

• Create, schedule, and post content across Instagram, TikTok,
,
/X, LinkedIn, YouTube, and Pinterest

• Develop a consistent brand voice and visual identity for Upstaxx across all channels

• Write compelling captions, hooks, and CTAs that drive engagement and sign-ups

• Create short-form video content (Reels, TikToks, Shorts) around tax tips, financial literacy, and Upstaxx features

• Monitor comments, DMs, and mentions — engage with the community daily

• Track analytics and report on growth, engagement, and conversion metrics weekly



Lead Generation & Growth

• Develop and execute strategies to drive sign-ups and free trial activations for Upstaxx

• Identify and engage target audiences: freelancers, gig workers, small business owners, W-2 employees

• Research and join relevant online communities 
 groups, Reddit, forums) to organically promote Upstaxx

• Collaborate on
 marketing content and landing page copy

• Test different content formats and CTAs to optimize conversion

• Track lead sources and report which channels are producing results



Content Creation

• Design graphics using Canva (or similar tools) that match Upstaxx branding

• Create educational content around tax savings, deductions, and financial tips

• Repurpose content across platforms (turn a blog post into 5 social posts, a Reel, and a carousel)

• Stay current on social media trends and adapt content strategy accordingly



Requirements

• 2+ years of social media management experience (agency or client-side)

• Proven track record of growing social media accounts (show us the numbers!)

• Experience with lead generation and conversion-focused content

• Strong written English — creative, engaging, and error-free

• Proficient with Canva, CapCut, or similar design/video editing tools

• Understanding of social media algorithms and best practices for each platform

• Experience with scheduling tools (Buffer, Later, Hootsuite, or similar)

• Self-starter who can work independently and take initiative

• Reliable internet connection + backup option

• Working laptop/PC with 8GB+ RAM



Bonus Skills (Not Required)

• Experience marketing SaaS or fintech products

•
/Instagram Ads experience

• SEO knowledge and blog writing

• Basic video editing for YouTube

• Familiarity with AI tools for content creation



What We Offer

• Competitive salary (based on experience)

• Flexible schedule within U.S. business hours

• Long-term, stable work with a growing brand

• Performance bonuses tied to growth milestones

• Creative freedom — your ideas matter here

• Supportive U.S. management team

• Paid time off after probation period





HOW TO APPLY — READ CAREFULLY

This is a PHASED application. We receive hundreds of applications. To find the best candidates quickly, we’ve designed a 2-phase process. Only candidates who complete Phase 1 correctly will be considered.



  PHASE 1 — APPLICATION (Complete by Monday, February 16 at 11:59 PM PHT)

Send an
 to: 

Subject Line: “BUZZING — Upstaxx Marketing VA — [Your Full Name]”



Your
 MUST include ALL of the following:

1. Your resume (PDF format)

2. Links to 2–3 social media accounts you have managed or grown (include follower counts and growth metrics)

3. A SpeedTest.net screenshot (minimum 25 Mbps download)

4. Your expected monthly salary range (in PHP)

5. Your OnlineJobs.ph profile link



PHASE 1 SCREENING TASK (Required):

In the SAME
, include the following:



SCREENING TASK:



Visit 
 and review the website thoroughly. Then answer these 3 questions:



1. In 2–3 sentences, describe what Upstaxx does and who their ideal customer is.

2. Write a sample Instagram caption (with hashtags) promoting Upstaxx to freelancers. Make it engaging, under 150 words.

3. Name 3 specific social media strategies you would use in the FIRST 30 DAYS to grow Upstaxx’s audience and generate leads. Be specific — not generic.



IMPORTANT: Applications missing ANY of the above will be automatically rejected. The subject line must start with “BUZZING” — this tells us you read the full post.



  PHASE 2 — VIDEO INTERVIEW (Tuesday, February 17)

Top candidates from Phase 1 will be invited to a 15–20 minute video interview via Google Meet on Tuesday, February 17.

What to expect:

• Discussion of your social media experience and portfolio

• Your approach to marketing Upstaxx specifically

• A quick creative exercise

• Q&A — your chance to ask us anything





About Worker Bees LLC

Worker Bees LLC helps U.S. entrepreneurs and businesses reclaim their time by providing high-quality virtual assistant support from the Philippines. We believe in fair pay, long-term partnerships, and empowering Filipino talent through meaningful career opportunities.

Bee More Productive.

title: Full-Stack Developer (Django REST + Nuxt 3)
description:
Thanks for taking a look at my Full-Stack Developer opportunity. This is a full time position - 40 hours weekly.



This contract is expected to last 1-2 months, with potential to work longer if things work out bewteen us. I am also willing to look at part-time applicants.



I run a standalone Pinterest keyword tool as well as a Pinterest Scheduler. I am looking for a developer to maintain the application and help me ship new features on an ongoing roadmap.



I am looking for a developer to assist me with the following key tasks and other smaller jobs:

    • Maintain and improve a Django REST API (bug fixes, refactors, performance tuning).

    • Maintain authentication flows (dj-rest-auth + django-allauth), including
 verification edge cases.

    • Maintain JWT access/refresh token flow used by the Nuxt frontend (Bearer tokens, refresh handling).

    • Maintain ThriveCart payment integration via webhooks (HMAC signature verification, plan mapping, subscription status).

    • Work with a shared PostgreSQL database, including read-only access to an existing keyword/interest table (query efficiency, pagination).

    • Improve logging/observability and troubleshoot production issues.

    • Deploy and maintain the app on 
 (environment variables, service configuration, domain/CORS settings).

    • Build and ship new product features as requested, starting with board analysis and competitor analysis.

    • Add future features such as: competitor/board analysis, saved searches, exports, filters, and general UX improvements.

    • Write lightweight documentation and short test checklists for features you ship.



Required skills:

• 3+ years of professional development experience (preferred).

• Strong Python, Django, and Django REST Framework experience (API design, permissions, serializers).

• Comfortable implementing
 verification using dj-rest-auth and django-allauth.

• Solid understanding of JWT access/refresh flows and client-side token management.

• Experience integrating and securing webhooks (HMAC verification; common failure modes).

• Strong PostgreSQL skills (pagination, query optimization; comfort working with unmanaged/read-only models).

• Strong Nuxt 3 / Vue 3 experience, including Pinia state management and API integration via Axios.

• Well organized and reliable (ability to manage ongoing maintenance plus new feature work).

• Good at written English.

• Attention to detail - when applying for this position, please start with 'Howdy Andy'.

• Quick response.

- The ability to communicate clearly and professionally through
.

- GitHub workflow: comfortable working via PRs with clear commit history.



Looking to hire and start immediately!



Please let me know what your salary expectations are and your availability (full-time or part-time).

Thanks,

Andy



PS. Only customized detailed responses will be considered. I want to know a bit of your background and how you will be a great addition - this way I know you are serious and have read the job description properly.

title: Part-Time Website QA Specialist (10–15 Hours per Week, Long-Term Potential)
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented Website QA Specialist to support our growing web team.



This role is ideal for someone who enjoys reviewing websites, spotting inconsistencies, testing functionality, and ensuring high-quality standards before pages go live. You will act as the quality gate between development and publishing.



This is a part-time freelance position for the first three months, starting at approximately 10 hours per week (with flexibility up to 15 hours max). If the collaboration works well, there is potential to grow into a more stable part-time role.



What You’ll Be Responsible For



• QA testing completed website builds before they are shared with stakeholders or published

• Reviewing pages across multiple websites to ensure consistency with our design system and style guide

• Checking that translations are correctly implemented and displayed in the proper language

• Identifying layout issues, spacing inconsistencies, broken elements, and visual bugs

• Testing forms, links, buttons, and interactive components

• Verifying responsive behavior across desktop, tablet, and mobile

• Documenting issues clearly and communicating them to the developer

• Performing ongoing health checks to prevent recurring bugs



What We’re Looking For



• Strong attention to detail. You notice small inconsistencies others miss.

• Experience with website QA, testing, or web project support

• Ability to test across different browsers and devices

• Organized and structured in documenting findings

• Comfortable working independently with clear expectations

• Strong written English (Other languages a plus) 



Nice to Have



• Experience working with Webflow or modern CMS platforms

• Experience with multilingual websites

• Basic understanding of UX and conversion-focused design

• Familiarity with tools like Notion, Google Docs, or bug-tracking tools



What This Role Is Not



This is not a developer role and not a design role. The focus is quality control, testing, and consistency.



Why This Role Is Important



As we scale our web production, maintaining quality is critical. We want someone who takes pride in being the final checkpoint before pages go live and who enjoys making sure everything is polished and functioning perfectly.



If you apply, please include:



- A short introduction about your QA or website testing experience

- An example of how you typically document bugs or QA findings

- The word “Quality First” at the top of your application so we know you’ve read the full description



We are looking for someone reliable and long-term oriented. If you enjoy structured work, high standards, and being the person who protects quality, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Instagram + TikTok Content Editor & Social Media VA (Collage Art / Reels)
description:
We’re hiring a reliable, creative, detail-oriented VA to help grow my wife’s collage art accounts on Instagram and TikTok. She creates collage-style artwork and will record the raw footage. Your job is to turn that footage into engaging short-form videos, create multiple versions from the same recording, schedule posts, write captions, and track performance so we can repeat what works and improve what doesn’t. Instagram: 



This role is primarily video editing for Reels and TikTok (potentially YouTube shorts as well) . You’ll take raw clips and produce clean, engaging edits with strong hooks, good pacing, and clear on-screen text. We want you to make different versions from the same footage (for example, different openings, text overlays, or endings) so we can test what performs best. You should be comfortable adding subtitles or captions, light sound design, and exporting in the right formats for both platforms.



You will also help with planning and consistency. Each week you’ll build a simple posting schedule, prepare content ahead of time, and schedule uploads with captions. We want someone who can contribute ideas for a practical posting strategy to drive followers and engagement, and who understands how short-form content works (hooks, retention, testing variations, and learning from analytics). The goal is steady growth and a repeatable content system that fits an art account.



Organization matters. You will create and maintain a Google Sheet to track what we post and how it performs. This should include the post date/time, video type, hook style, length, caption approach, hashtags, and performance results. Once per week, you’ll share a short summary of what performed best and your best guess as to why, plus what you recommend we test next.



This is a part-time role to start (around 10–20 hours per week) with flexible hours, as long as weekly deliverables and deadlines are met. We want to form this into a full-time role long term. Please include your rate (hourly or weekly/monthly). We are open to hourly at the beginning and moving to a fixed deliverables structure once the workflow is consistent. If we work hourly, we may use OnlineJobs.ph TimeProof during working time only, and we’re happy to reduce or remove tracking once we establish trust and consistent results.



To apply, please send a short intro and your relevant experience editing Reels/TikToks, plus 2–4 examples of short-form edits you’ve done (portfolio links are fine). Tell us what editing tools you use, your typical turnaround time, and what weekly posting cadence you would suggest for an art/collage account like ours. Include your rate and your availability to start.



Finalists may be asked to do a small paid test using a short raw clip we provide. You would create two 10–20 second edit variations with different hooks/text/endings, and provide a caption and hashtags.

title: YouTube Video Editor Needed for Mystery & Geography Channel (Faceless Videos)
description:

title: Executive Assistant for Growing Esthetician Academy
description:
About the Role



Tizzy Essential Academy is looking for a highly organized, proactive, and detail-oriented Executive Assistant to work directly with our leadership team. This role is critical in ensuring the smooth execution of both client-facing and behind-the-scenes operations, allowing our coaches and mentors to focus on strategy, mentorship, and content creation.



The ideal candidate is professional, resourceful, and thrives in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. You’ll manage scheduling, systems, and communication with a focus on excellence and efficiency. 



About Tizzy Essential Academy



Tizzy Essential Academy is a mentorship and business coaching company for estheticians. We help beauty professionals build profitable businesses and achieve consistent $10K+ months through proven strategies, mentorship, and hands-on guidance. With a growing client base and expanding brand presence, we are seeking a dedicated Executive Assistant to support our operations, client communication, and overall business growth.



Responsibilities



* Calendar & Scheduling: Manage calendars, book mentorship calls, and coordinate group coaching sessions.

* Client Communication: Act as the first point of contact for client inquiries, onboarding, and scheduling questions, ensuring all clients feel supported and valued.

* Systems & Organization: Maintain files, organize resources, and oversee updates to the mentorship Playbook, booking links, and client portals.

* Project Management: Track deliverables, deadlines, and client progress. Ensure tasks are completed on time and nothing falls through the cracks.

* Social Media Support (Light): Assist with scheduling posts, organizing content, and managing inquiries.

* Travel & Logistics: Coordinate travel, events, flights, hotels, podcasts, or speaking engagements when necessary.

* Admin Support: Handle
 management, document prep, invoices, and other administrative tasks.



Qualifications



* High levels of critical thinking skills, we are not moms or babysitters. (REQUIRED)

* 2+ years of administrative or executive assistant experience in coaching, consulting, or online business (REQUIRED).

* Would like but not required - - Esthetician experience (HIGHLY PREFERRED)

* Excellent written and verbal communication skills when speaking to our American students

* Strong organizational and time management abilities. (Please do NOT forget your assigned tasks.)

* Tech-savvy with tools like Google Workspace, Zoom, Skool, GoHighLevel, Podium, and 

* Confident, professional, and able to handle confidential information.

* Self-starter who takes initiative, solves problems, and anticipates needs.



Preferred (but not required)



* Experience in the beauty, aesthetics, or coaching/consulting industry.

* Familiarity with social media management tools (Meta Business Suite, Instagram, or similar).

* Basic knowledge of client onboarding systems or CRMs.

* Comfortability with sales to improve client retention and ascension



Perks

* Work directly with the founder of a fast-growing mentorship brand.

* Flexible remote position with growth opportunities.

* Supportive and empowering work environment.

* Bonuses when you retain a client or ascend them into our alumni program



Position Details



* Role Type: Full-time (40+ hours/week)

* Location: Remote

* Compensation: Competitive hourly rate or monthly retainer (based on experience)

 with your resume, CV, AND a 1-min Loom video on why you'd be a good fit

title: Bookkeeper and Financial Operations Specialist
description:
Job Title: Bookkeeper / Accountant (Real Estate Investment)

Location: Remote | Type: Full-Time

Industry: Real Estate (Long-Term Rentals, Short-Term Rentals, Flips)



About Us:

We are a startup real estate investment company specializing in long-term and short-term rentals (Airbnb/VRBO) and property flips. Our mission is to provide high-quality living spaces and maximize returns for our investors. This is a startup company with no formal training materials. We are looking for someone with past experience in property management and bookkeeping who is proactive, able to ask questions, and update us on their progress regularly.



Role Overview:

We are seeking a detail-oriented Bookkeeper/Accountant to manage the financial operations of our real estate portfolio. This role involves handling daily transactions, budgeting, financial reporting, and tax preparation across multiple property types.



Key Responsibilities:

- Maintain financial records and manage accounts payable/receivable, reconciliations, and the general ledger

- Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements

- Track income and expenses for each property, including renovations and repairs

- Monitor cash flow, assist in budgeting, and help with forecasting

- Prepare documentation for tax filings and coordinate with external accountants

- Handle mortgage, insurance, and property tax payments

- Manage rent payments and security deposit refunds

- Use Buildium Property Management Software for financial tracking and reporting



Qualifications:

- 2+ years of experience in property management or real estate accounting

- Proven experience managing rental property accounting, including handling income, expenses, and taxes

- Strong knowledge of accounting software (QuickBooks, Xero, etc.) and Microsoft Excel

- Must have experience in real estate or property management bookkeeping

- Highly organized with a strong attention to detail

- Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal

- Available to respond during Colorado business hours and attend weekly meetings



Compensation:

- We offer $500 for the first month as a probation period to assess your skills and commitment. If you pass, we’ll proceed with the agreed-upon rate, which will be finalized before the probation starts. 



How to Apply:

Please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience with rental accounting, including how you've managed the accounting side of rentals in your previous roles. We also welcome any references or relevant work samples.



Please apply using this link: 



We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Virtual Assistant (UGC Breifs)
description:
Role: UGC Brief Manager

Core Responsibility

Own the creation, distribution, and tracking of UGC briefs to ensure creators clearly understand what to film and deliver high-quality, on-brand content.

Key Responsibilities

UGC Brief Creation

Write clear, concise UGC briefs for creators based on campaign goals.

Translate angles, hooks, and concepts into simple creator-friendly instructions.

Create and update scripts, talking points, shot lists, and B-roll requirements.

Adapt briefs for different creator types eg mums, sons, couples, girlfriends, professionals.

Brief Distribution & Tracking

Send the correct brief and assets to each creator.

Ensure creators fully understand expectations, tone, and deliverables.

Track who has received briefs, confirmed, needs clarification, or requires follow-up.

Manage shoot timelines and delivery deadlines.

Organisation & Systems

Log all briefs, creator assignments, and statuses in Notion.

Update progress clearly eg brief sent, confirmed, filming, delivered.

Ensure no creator films without the correct and latest brief.

Flag gaps in coverage eg missing angles, demographics, or formats.

Quality Control

Review creator submissions against the brief before approval.

Identify missing shots, weak delivery, or off-brief content early.

Request revisions or additional footage when required.

Maintain consistency in tone, structure, and message across all UGC.

Communication & Coordination

Respond to creator questions quickly and clearly.

Provide direction without overcomplicating or overwhelming creators.

Coordinate with the content team when briefs need refinement or updates.

Requirements

Strong written English with an understanding of Australian tone and phrasing.

Extremely organised and detail-oriented.

Able to manage multiple briefs and creators simultaneously.

Fast response times and consistent daily output.

Comfortable using:

Notion

Google Drive

Slack

Experience with UGC, influencer content, creator briefs, or content operations is a plus.

Ideal Qualities

Clear communicator who can simplify complex ideas.

Reliable and consistent with strong follow-through.

Good judgement for brand tone and audience fit.

Enjoys structured, fast-paced, high-volume work.

Understands what makes UGC feel natural, not scripted.

title: Part-time Capcut / TikTok Editor
description:
Hiring for part-time work for a Capcut / TikTok editor with potential for more



You will be making TikTok videos using Capcut or the video editing software of your choice.  The editing process is fairly simple and straightforward.  Anyone who is proficient in video editing should have no problem with the basic tasks such as:

- Cutting dead space in talking head videos

- Adding overlay images on screen in the videos

- Minor effects such as dynamic zoom, cropping, etc.

- Producing b-roll content from voiceover and footage provided, having the ability to digest what is being said and pair up the     audio with corresponding footage



Please review a few examples of my content to ensure you are familiar and comfortable with the editing style:

1. Basic talking head - here you are mostly editing dead space and piecing clips together.


 



2. Talking head with overlays - same as before, but adding images and stickers provided to you on the screen to support what is being said in the video.





3. Faceless Content – similar to the previous examples, but focused on creating faceless clips of the product itself.





4. B-roll - you will be provided a voice over and need to work through the footage to find fitting visuals. A strong understanding of English and social media content is crucial here.


 



You will be working hand in hand with me on an extremely viral social media page and there is room for bonuses if deadlines are met and the content performs well!



Requirements:

- Attention to detail

- STRONG English

- Strong internet connection

- Previous experience with Capcut / TikTok / Instagram

- Good working with a team

- Ability to learn and take constructive feedback

- Availability to work 3-4hrs a day (with potential for more and increased salary)

- Able to work 6 days per week (can take days off whenever as long as mostly consistent)

- Can take payments through Wise

- PH or similar time zone



$350/month + bonuses for 3-4hrs a day MAX and potential full time work in the future with a salary increase.

title: DM Appointment Setter
description:
We run a world-class online fitness coaching company helping busy Asian men lose stubborn belly fat, build lean muscle, and stay in shape without cutting out the cultural foods they love.



Our brand and client base is growing fast. As a result, we are rapidly expanding our team and looking for a high-performance DM setter who knows how to turn conversations into booked calls so we can help even more people!



If you thrive in a results-driven environment and want uncapped earning potential, keep reading.



Compensation:



- Full-time: 40–50 hours per week

- Pay: $650 USD per month

- Commission: 3-5% of cash collected from every client you book who enrolls

- Expected Earnings: $800–$1,200+ per month



**Top performers earn significantly more. This is a performance-based role. Your income scales with your output.



What You’ll Be Responsible For:



- Initiating conversations with new followers, story viewers, and engaged prospects

- Reaching out to warm and targeted outbound leads daily

- Using our scripts + frameworks while making conversations feel natural and human

- Asking intelligent qualifying questions

- Moving qualified prospects into booked sales calls

- Following up consistently with warm leads

- Tracking conversations and outcomes inside our CRM

- Maintaining our brand voice and communication standards

- You will be expected to generate volume while maintaining quality.



What We’re Looking For:



- Strong written English (clear, natural, professional — no grammar mistakes)

- Quick response speed and ability to handle multiple conversations at once

- 1–3+ years of experience as a DM setter (fitness industry preferred)

- Proven history of booking qualified calls that actually show up

- Reliable laptop + fast internet

- Comfortable sending 80–100+ high-quality messages per day

- Willing to work flexible hours, including weekends when needed

- Highly coachable and able to take feedback fast

- Competitive, disciplined, and motivated by performance

- We move quickly. You must be comfortable keeping up.



Why This Is a Big Opportunity:



- Work directly with a rapidly scaling online fitness coaching company with a passion for client results and excellence across the board

- Clear SOPs, scripts, and leadership support

- Real growth path for top performers (raises + leadership opportunities)

- Paid onboarding and training

- Remote position

- Be part of a team with high standards and long-term vision

- We value excellence, accountability, and growth.



How To Apply:



Send a short message replying to this job post explaining why you want to apply



**within 24-72 hours, all eligible applicants will be invited to an interview.



Looking forward to speaking with you!

title: Performance Marketer
description:
We’re hiring a full-time Media Buyer to own our paid advertising performance across platforms, with a primary focus on Meta 
 & Instagram Ads). This role is full-time and in-house (remote), so please only apply if you’re looking for a long-term permanent position. We're not hiring freelance or agency. 



This role is ideal for someone who is data-driven, detail-oriented, and excited to work closely with creatives to improve ad performance through clear insights and testing.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

- Launch, manage, and optimize ad campaigns primarily on Meta Ads. Support campaigns on Google, TikTok, or other platforms where relevant.

- Plan and execute structured tests (angles, creatives, offers, landing page) to improve cost per acquisition and ROAS.

- Manage budgets, audiences, and campaign structures based on performance

- Analyze ad performance to identify winning and underperforming ads

- Communicate clear performance insights to the creative team

- Participate in brainstorming sessions to improve creatives based on data

- Analyze Shopify sales data to identify scaling opportunities, conversion bottlenecks and product-level performance

- Monitor competitors’ ads, offers, and campaigns to identify gaps or opportunities in our market niche.

- Stay up-to-date with DTC industry trends and platform updates to ensure best practices.

- Providing administrative support, as and when needed to the manager.



Requirements

- Full-time, Monday–Friday (9am–5pm PH time)

- Remote position

- Strong comfort working with numbers and data

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; able to interpret data to make informed decisions

- Able to explain performance clearly to non-technical teammates

- Highly organized, self-directed, execution-focused, and able to work independently

- Willing to learn quickly and adapt as the business grows

- No prior media buying experience required, but you must be sharp, analytical, and able to learn fast.



Nice To Have (but not required):

- Experience running Meta Ads

- Experience with Shopify analytics

- Familiarity with Google Ads, TikTok Ads

- Experience in DTC or performance marketing



What We Offer

- Competitive salary

- Performance-based bonuses

- Paid annual leave & public holidays

- Fully remote work

- Training, upskilling, and career growth opportunities

- A team that values ownership, clarity, and results



Application

Please send your application via
 to 
 with the subject line: "Performance Marketer – (Your Name)”. Include your OnlineJobsPH profile link and answers to the questions below in numbered format directly in the
 body:

1) Tell us about your most recent job. What did you mainly work on, what were some challenges you faced, and why did you d
 to leave?

2) If you’ve worked in media buying/advertising, tell us about the campaigns you handled, tools you used, your process, and results. If you haven’t, what have you been learning on your own and how would you get competent quickly?

3) Share a time you took initiative or solved a problem in your workplace. It doesn’t have to be a formal leadership role, just something you’re proud of.

4) Please submit as much of your portfolio as possible. Submitting more work will help us make a more informed decision. Work can include anything within DTC e-commerce industry, but ideally aligned to the role you are applying for. If you don’t have DTC experience, submit your best work portfolio. Strong portfolios outside this role may be considered for other roles. 

5) Pick one project from the attached portfolio in question (4) that you are most proud of and answer the questions below. We want to see your ability to clearly explain what you did, your role, your reasoning, and the results of your work. You may optionally pick more than 1 project to highlight additional skills.

- What the project was

- Your specific contribution

- Why you approached it this way

- The results or impact (if any)



Keywords

 ads,
 ads specialist,
 ads manager,
 advertising, meta ads, meta ads specialist, meta ads manager, meta ads buyer, fb ads manager, media buyer,
 media buyer, paid ads buyer, performance marketer, performance ads, digital advertising, digital marketing, online advertising, social media advertising, ecommerce ads, google ads, DTC, DTC ads, pmax ads, pmax campaigns, performance max, youtube, tiktok, pinterest, ads specialist, ads buyer, ads manager, ads strategist, brand strategist, ads manager, growth marketer, CRO specialist, shopify

- Plan and execute structured tests (angles, creatives, offers, landing page) to improve cost per acquisition and ROAS.

- Manage budgets, audiences, and campaign structures based on performance

- Analyze ad performance to identify winning and underperforming ads

- Communicate clear performance insights to the creative team

- Participate in brainstorming sessions to improve creatives based on data

- Analyze Shopify sales data to identify scaling opportunities, conversion bottlenecks and product-level performance

- Monitor competitors’ ads, offers, and campaigns to identify gaps or opportunities in our market niche.

- Stay up-to-date with DTC industry trends and platform updates to ensure best practices.

- Providing administrative support, as and when needed to the manager.



Requirements

- Full-time, Monday–Friday (9am–5pm PH time)

- Remote position

- Strong comfort working with numbers and data

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; able to interpret data to make informed decisions

- Able to explain performance clearly to non-technical teammates

- Highly organized, self-directed, execution-focused, and able to work independently

- Willing to learn quickly and adapt as the business grows

- No prior media buying experience required, but you must be sharp, analytical, and able to learn fast.



Nice To Have (but not required):

- Experience running Meta Ads

- Experience with Shopify analytics

- Familiarity with Google Ads, TikTok Ads

- Experience in DTC or performance marketing



What We Offer

- Competitive salary

- Performance-based bonuses

- Paid annual leave & public holidays

- Fully remote work

- Training, upskilling, and career growth opportunities

- A team that values ownership, clarity, and results



Application

Please send your application via
 to 
 with the subject line: "DTC Media Buyer – (Your Name)”. Include your OnlineJobsPH profile link and answers to the questions below in numbered format directly in the
 body:

1) Tell us about your most recent job. What did you mainly work on, what were some challenges you faced, and why did you d
 to leave?

2) If you’ve worked in media buying/advertising, tell us about the campaigns you handled, tools you used, your process, and results. If you haven’t, what have you been learning on your own and how would you get competent quickly?

3) Share a time you took initiative or solved a problem in your workplace. It doesn’t have to be a formal leadership role, just something you’re proud of.

4) Please submit as much of your portfolio as possible. Submitting more work will help us make a more informed decision. Work can include anything within DTC e-commerce industry, but ideally aligned to the role you are applying for. If you don’t have DTC experience, submit your best work portfolio. Strong portfolios outside this role may be considered for other roles. 

5) Pick one project from the attached portfolio in question (4) that you are most proud of and answer the questions below. We want to see your ability to clearly explain what you did, your role, your reasoning, and the results of your work. You may optionally pick more than 1 project to highlight additional skills.

- What the project was

- Your specific contribution

- Why you approached it this way

- The results or impact (if any)



Keywords

 ads,

 advertising, meta ads, meta ads specialist, meta ads manager, meta ads buyer, fb ads manager, media buyer,
 media buyer, paid ads buyer, performance marketer, performance ads, digital advertising, digital marketing, online advertising, social media advertising, ecommerce ads, google ads, DTC, DTC ads, pmax ads, pmax campaigns, performance max, youtube, tiktok, pinterest, ads specialist, ads buyer, ads manager, ads strategist, brand strategist, ads manager, growth marketer, CRO specialist, shopify

title: Operations/Logistics Manager
description:
We are looking for a detail-oriented Operations & Logistics Manager to oversee end-to-end operational execution across inventory, logistics, 3PL, and cross-platform order management.

This role is critical in ensuring operational accuracy, inventory health, and smooth coordination across internal teams and external partners.



* This person needs to work basis on New York Times (EST) so please be aware of this! 



[Key responsibilities]

Inventory & Operations Management

- Manage all inventory operations across warehouses, 3PLs, and sales channels

- Track and maintain accurate inventory levels, inventory value, and inventory projections

- Identify, analyze, and resolve inventory discrepancies and inaccurate order reports

- Monitor inventory flow to prevent stockouts or overstock situations



Logistics & 3PL Management

- Own day-to-day communication and performance management of 3PL partners

- Ensure accurate order fulfillment, shipping timelines, and issue resolution

- Conduct regular third-party system and data sync checks (3PL, Shopify, TikTok Shop, etc.)



Platform & System Management

- Manage and monitor inventory across Shopify & TikTok Shop, ensuring accurate syncing and reporting

- Troubleshoot order, inventory, and system integration issues across platforms



Order Processing & Customer Support

- Receive and process purchase orders (POs), ensuring accuracy and timely execution

- Handle customer service inquiries via
 and social media messages, including order issues, shipping questions, and general support

- Coordinate with 3PL and internal teams to resolve customer-related fulfillment issues efficiently



Invoice, Admin & Cross-Functional Support

- Prepare and send out invoices related to operations and logistics

- Provide personal assistance and operational administrative support as needed

- Assist with product management, including SKU setup, tracking, and operational readiness for launches

- Collaborate closely with finance, marketing, and supply chain teams to ensure operational alignment





Qualifications

- 8+ years of experience in operations, logistics, supply chain, or inventory management

- Hands-on experience with Shopify, 3PL systems, and inventory tools

- Experience managing multiple third-party vendors

- Highly detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills

- Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment

- Strong Excel / Google Sheets skills (inventory tracking & projections)

Requirements

We are looking for someone experienced, proactive, and creative who can collaborate with our team as the role grows.

title: Junior Automations Specialist (N8n/Click Up/GHL)
description:
Sojourney is a STR (short-term rental) company looking for a fast-learning, long-term tea
mber to grow into our go-to Automations Specialist. This is not an internship—but it is an entry/junior role where we’ll provide significant training upfront for the right person.



If you love systems, learn quickly, and want to build a career in automations + AI inside a growing company, this role is for you.



What you’ll become responsible for (with training)



Building and improving automations using n8n, Click Up and GoHighLevel (GHL)



Supporting multiple departments with automations (operations, support, sales/marketing, onboarding, etc.)



Troubleshooting, debugging, and fixing automation errors independently (broken steps, API/webhook issues, data problems)



Creating workflows/templates for our clients and students (implementation + support)



Managing automation projects and documentation in ClickUp (tasks, updates, SOPs, handoffs)



Continuously learning new automation platforms and AI tools (different LLMs, agents, integrations) and helping our team apply them



This role is a fit if you are…



Looking to commit multiple years with one company and grow into a key role



A fast learner who takes initiative and adapts quickly



Comfortable taking feedback and improving fast (coachable)



Able to work quickly without sacrificing quality



Someone who enjoys problem-solving and can debug issues without needing constant help



Minimum requirements



Basic/intro understanding of automations (you’ve used or explored tools like n8n, Zapier, Make, GHL, or similar—even if not advanced yet)



Familiarity with APIs, webhooks, CRMs, Google Sheets, Slack, etc.



Can build basic workflows using n8n, Click Up and Go High Level



Strong troubleshooting mindset (you test, isolate problems, and verify fixes)



Clear communication and willingness to document your work



Interest or experience in STR / hospitality / property management (context matters)





What success looks like



Month 1: Understand our systems, start building simple workflows, and assist with troubleshooting



Month 2–3: Own automations end-to-end with minimal supervision, document consistently, improve reliability



Ongoing: Become the person responsible for automation quality across the company and help us stay current with new tools/LLMs



To apply



Please use 4 AP points when applying and include:



Weekly availability



Your automation exposure (what tools you’ve used and what you built—even small projects count)



A short note on your interest/experience in STR/hospitality/property management



One example of how you troubleshoot when something breaks (steps you take)



Please note: a test task workflow will be needed in order to be considered for the role if we contact you

title: Graphic Design Virtual Assistant (POD / Long-Term Role)
description:
JOB OVERVIEW

We are building a premium POD brand, AXIOMSTEEL, and are looking for a reliable, detail-oriented Graphic Design Virtual Assistant to help us scale production.

This is a long-term role for someone who wants stable work and consistent hours.

You will be helping produce structured, repeatable product designs.

We are building a serious brand — not a hobby.





RESPONSIBILITIES

You will:

• Create design variations from existing templates

• Replace names, dates, and personalized text

• Maintain correct spacing and alignment

• Follow brand font and hierarchy rules

• Organize design folders properly

• Mockup image preparation

• Follow clear SOPs and naming conventions

This role is production-focused and detail-oriented.



REQUIRED SKILLS

You MUST:

• Be highly skilled in Adobe Illustrator

• Understand vector design and SVG file export

• Have strong typography skills

• Be very detail-oriented

• Follow instructions precisely

• Work independently once trained

• Have stable internet

• Communicate clearly in English



Bonus if you have experience with:

• Print-on-demand

• Etsy product image preparation

 



IMPORTANT

This job requires consistency and precision.

If you are creative but do not like structured systems, this role is not for you.

If you enjoy organized workflows and improving speed/efficiency, this role is perfect.





APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS

To apply, please:

1. Include the word STEEL at the top of your application.

2. Send 3 examples of vector-based design work.

3. Tell me how long it takes you (realistically) to create 3 simple design variations from a template.

4. Confirm your internet speed.

Applications that do not follow instructions will not be reviewed.





LONG-TERM OPPORTUNITY

We are scaling toward ongoing production work. The right candidate will grow with us.

s

 campaigns and templates

title: Supply Chain & Inventory Planning Manager
description:
[Summary]

- Location: Remote

- Employment Type: Full-Time (40 hours/week)

- Work Schedule: 4 hours (8am-12pm) with EST, 4 hours aligned with Philippines Time

- Hourly pay : $8~10 



[Role Overview] 

- We are seeking a highly analytical Supply Chain & Inventory Planning Manager to lead inventory strategy, demand forecasting, working capital management, and 3PL coordination across multiple warehouse locations and sales channels. This role requires both operational execution and structured strategic planning. You will be responsible for organizing existing processes, improving forecast accuracy, preventing stockouts and overstock, reducing aging inventory, and protecting cash flow. This is a critical role within a scaling beauty brand operating across DTC, wholesale, and marketplace channels.



[Key responsibilities] 



1. Inventory & Replenishment Planning

- Oversee inventory across multiple warehouse locations

- Establish safety stock levels and reorder points

- Prevent stockouts and overstock situations

- Monitor lot tracking and expiration risk

- Build structured replenishment models



2. Demand Forecasting & Sales Alignment

- Develop SKU-level demand forecasts

- Integrate promotional calendar into forecast planning

- Forecast seasonal spikes and campaign-driven volume

- Lead monthly Sales & Operations Planning (S&OP) process

- Continuously improve forecast accuracy



3. Inventory Valuation & Working Capital Management

- Conduct inventory valuation reporting

- Monitor inventory turnover and days on hand

- Manage inventory impact on cash flow

- Align production timing with working capital strategy

- Reduce excess inventory exposure



4. Inventory Aging & Liquidation Strategy

- Build structured 6M / 9M / 12M aging reports

- Identify slow-moving SKUs early

- Develop liquidation plans (bundles, promotional allocation, wholesale offload)

- Minimize write-offs due to expiration



5. Financial & Cost Analysis

- Calculate landed cost per SKU (production, freight, duty, 3PL)

- Analyze margin impact from promotions and shipping subsidies

- Monitor fulfillment cost efficiency

- Support channel-level profitability analysis



6. 3PL & Fulfillment Management

- Primary point of contact for 3PL partners

- Monitor pick & pack accuracy and SLA performance

- Optimize shipping cost strategy

- Improve fulfillment efficiency



7. Purchase Order & Production Coordination

- Execute and track Purchase Orders

- Coordinate with manufacturers on lead times

- Manage MOQ planning and production scheduling

- Identify and mitigate supply chain risks



8. Process & System Development

- Build structured inventory dashboards

- Develop SOPs for replenishment and reporting

- Identify operational inefficiencies

- Recommend automation or system improvements



Qualifications

- 5+ years in supply chain, inventory planning, or operations

- Experience in beauty, skincare, or consumer goods preferred

- Strong multi-channel inventory management experience

- Advanced Excel / Google Sheets modeling skills

- Experience working with 3PL partners

- Strong analytical and financial planning capability

- Ability to work independently in a remote, cross-timezone environment



[Application Requirements]



Please submit:

- Resume

- Example of forecasting model created

- Brief explanation of how you improved inventory efficiency

- Confirmation of availability across EST and Philippines time zones

title: Strategic FP&A Manager (Part-Time)

- Support annual budgeting process



2. SKU-Level Margin & Profitability Analysis

- Conduct detailed gross margin and contribution margin analysis

- Evaluate DTC vs Wholesale vs Marketplace profitability

- Identify margin leakage from promotions and shipping subsidies

- Provide pricing and promotion recommendations



3. Promotional & Scenario Modeling

- Build financial models to evaluate discount strategies

- Analyze bundle economics and campaign profitability

- Assess CAC impact on contribution margin

- Provide pre-launch financial feasibility analysis



4. Cash Flow & Working Capital Planning

- Build cash flow projections

- Align financial forecasts with inventory and production planning

- Monitor working capital exposure

- Improve cash predictability



5. Executive Reporting & Strategic Insights

- Develop structured monthly financial dashboard

- Provide clear executive-level summaries

- Identify financial risks early

- Present actionable recommendations to leadership



Qualifications

- 7+ years experience in FP&A, strategic finance, or financial modeling

- Experience in consumer goods, beauty, or DTC & Wholesale preferred

- Advanced Excel / Google Sheets modeling skills (required)

- Strong understanding of contribution margin and unit economics

- Ability to build scenario models from scratch

- Experience supporting founder-led or growth-stage companies preferred



Application Requirements



Please submit:

- Resume

- Example of a financial model you built (template acceptable)

- Brief explanation of how you improved profitability in a prior role

- Shortlisted candidates may be asked to complete a modeling exercise.

title: Content VA / Video Content Mining Specialist — Wrestling & Combat Sports Media (Full-Time)
description:
Do you have an eye for what makes people stop scrolling?



We run two media brands in the combat sports space. We have over 10 years of video content — thousands of hours of training footage, match clips, coaching sessions, and behind-the-scenes 
nts — sitting in a vault waiting to be turned into viral Shorts, Reels, and TikToks.



We need someone obsessive about content to come in and systematically mine that library, find the gold, organize everything, and keep our social media engines running across multiple platforms and multiple brands every single day.



This isn't a "post once a day and call it done" gig. You'll be the backbone of our entire content operation — the person who makes sure our video editor always has clips to cut, our content calendar is always full, and our audience is always being fed.



The Two Brands You'll Be Working Across:



Brand 1 — Championship-level amateur wrestling instruction with 10+ years of training footage. Think intense, high-energy, coach-to-athlete content.



Brand 2 — Combat sports education and analysis. Deep library of instructional and analytical content.



What You'll Be Doing:



Content Mining & Organization (This Is the Big One — ~40% of Your Time)

- Systematically watch through our entire video libraries for both brands

- Log every video in a master spreadsheet: title, duration, topic, key 
nts with timestamps, "gold rating" (1–5), and suggested clip ideas

- Identify the 
nts that would make great Shorts — high energy technique demos, dramatic reactions, clean takedowns, quotable coaching 
nts, training montages, rivalry clips

- Tag and categorize content: technique tutorials, match footage, training sessions, coaching/motivational, behind-the-scenes, product-specific

- Organize raw files into a clean, labeled folder structure so our editor can find and grab what they need instantly

- Maintain and update the content log as new footage comes in



Content Scheduling & Posting (~30% of Your Time)

- Manage content calendars across both brands and all platforms (YouTube Shorts, Instagram Reels, TikTok,
)

- Upload, write captions, add hashtags, and publish all finished content on schedule

- Write captions from templates and brand voice guides we provide (you'll get trained on each brand's tone)

- Schedule content in advance using tools like Metricool, Later, or native platform schedulers

- Ensure we never miss a posting day — consistency is everything



Community Engagement & Performance Tracking (~20% of Your Time)

- Monitor and reply to comments across all platforms (we'll give you response guidelines)

- Flag DMs and comments that need the founders' attention

- Track basic performance metrics weekly: views, engagement rate, follower growth, saves, shares

- Maintain a simple weekly report — what posted, what performed, what flopped, and why you think so

- Identify trending content in our niches and flag opportunities to jump on trends



Research & Support (~10% of Your Time)

- Research trending audio, formats, hashtags, and content styles in the wrestling and combat sports niche

- Scout competitor accounts and flag content ideas worth adapting or responding to

- Maintain asset libraries: thumbnails, brand templates, music/audio files, b-roll folders

- Assist with miscellaneous tasks as needed — we're a small team and flexibility matters



You MUST Have:



- Strong English skills (written — we communicate via chat, Loom, and shared docs)

- Experience managing social media accounts and posting content consistently (show us the accounts you've managed)

- Familiarity with at least one scheduling tool (Later, Buffer, Metricool, Hootsuite, or native platform schedulers)

- Attention to detail — you'll be logging hundreds of videos and we need accuracy, not sloppiness

- Ability to work independently with minimal supervision after training

- A genuine eye for engaging content — you can tell the difference between a clip that will get 500 views and one that will get 50,000

- Reliable internet and a quiet workspace with headphones (you'll be watching hours of video daily)

- Willingness to overlap with US Central Time (CST) for at least 3–4 hours daily

- Proficiency with Google Drive, Google Sheets, and basic file management



Bonus Points (Not Required But We'll Love You For It):



- Interest in wrestling, combat sports, or martial arts (understanding the content makes you faster)

- Experience with short-form video platforms as a creator or avid consumer (if your own TikTok For You page is full of combat sports content, tell us)

- Basic photo/video editing skills (even just CapCut-level trimming and captioning)

- Experience with Canva for creating thumbnails or simple graphics

- Familiarity with YouTube analytics, Instagram Insights, or TikTok analytics dashboards

- Experience working with content creators or media brands (not just corporate social accounts)



What It's Like Working With Us:



- Small team, fast-moving, zero bureaucracy

- You'll work directly with the founders — not middle managers

- We communicate async (Loom, Slack/chat) with a weekly sync call

- We'll train you on exactly what "gold" content looks like — you don't need to figure it out alone

- Clear expectations, direct feedback, and real growth opportunity

- If you're great at this, there's room to grow into a content manager role as we scale



To Apply — READ THIS CAREFULLY:



We get a lot of applications. To make sure you actually read this post, do the following:



1. Start your application with the word **"TAKEDOWN"** so we know you read the full posting.



2. Watch this video: 
 



3. In your application, timestamp 3 specific 
nts from that video that you think would make great Shorts or Reels. For each 
nt, write 1-2 sentences explaining WHY you picked it — what makes it engaging, scroll-stopping, or shareable.



4. Send links to 2-3 social media accounts you've managed or contributed to. If you don't have professional examples, send your own personal accounts and tell us what content strategy you follow.



5. Tell us your available hours, timezone, and current workload (are you working other jobs?).



**Do NOT send a generic application.** If your application doesn't start with "TAKEDOWN" and include timestamps, we won't read it.

title: Full-Time US Healthcare Revenue Cycle Specialist (DrChrono Experience Required) Insurance Verification | Claims | AR Fol

title: Sales Caller – Book Meetings With Warm Leads (Remote, Part-Time)
description:
About Us

We're a growing marketing agency looking for confident, friendly phone callers to help us book meetings with interested prospects. These are warm leads only — people who have already shown interest in our service. No cold calling.

The Role

You'll receive notifications when a new lead comes in. Your job is to call them quickly, let them know about the interest we've found for their business, and book them into a meeting. We provide the script, the talking points, and even AI-generated notes for each lead so you know exactly what to say. You just make the call and book the meeting.

What You'll Be Doing



Receiving lead notifications via Slack on your phone

Calling warm leads within 5–10 minutes of the notification

Following a simple script to explain the opportunity

Booking meetings using a provided Calendly link

Recording each call for quality and accountability



Time Commitment: Less than 3–5 hours per week. This is not an hours-worked role — it's a speed-to-lead role. When a notification comes in, you call fast. Between notifications, you're free. You'll be set up on Slack with mobile notifications so you can respond quickly wherever you are.

Requirements



Clear Western accent is required (American, British, Australian, or similar) — you will be calling US and UK-based business owners and executives. You must sound natural and professional on the phone. If you do not have a clear Western accent, please do not apply.

Confident and friendly phone manner

Reliable phone and internet connection

Available and responsive during US business hours — speed is everything in this role. If you can't call within 5–10 minutes of a notification, this isn't for you.

Slack on your phone with notifications enabled

Quiet environment for calls



Compensation



$100/month base salary

$100 per confirmed, shown booking (not just scheduled — the prospect must actually show up)

On the low end, expect 10+ bookings per month

Realistic earnings: $1,100+/month for less than 5 hours of actual work per week



Why This Role



No cold calling — every lead has already shown interest

Scripts and talking points provided — we tell you exactly what to say

Minimal time commitment — it's about speed, not hours worked

High pay per hour of actual work — at 10 bookings and 5 hrs/week, that's $50+/hr effective rate

Long-term role — consistent lead flow with growing volume

Flexible remote work



To Apply

Send a voice note (30–60 seconds) introducing yourself in English, along with a short message about any phone or sales experience you have. Include the word "buckets" so we know you've read this post.

title: SDR (COSMETIC INJECTABLES TRAINING PROGRAM) USA/CANADA
description:
****NOTE PLEASE READ*******

 If you do not have experience working with a Medical Clinic or working directly with Nurses, this may not be the role for you. There is a SIGNIFICANT amount of knowledge to retain in regards to Cosmetic Injectables and having experience in the space will set you apart aggressively from any other candidates! 

***************************



Sales Development Representative (Healthcare / Aesthetic Medicine)



DM Setting + Outbound Calls | Growth to Discovery Closer | Long-Term Role



We are the International Institute of Aesthetic Medicine (IIAM) — a leading North American training institute that certifies medical professionals in cosmetic injectables (Botox, dermal fillers, PRP, advanced aesthetic treatments).



We train physicians, nurse practitioners, physician assistants, and nurses who want to enter or grow in aesthetic medicine.



We are looking for a high-level SDR who can:



• Set appointments via Instagram &
 

• Make outbound calls to warm leads

• Pre-qualify healthcare professionals

• Eventually grow into running discovery calls



This is a long-term opportunity with serious growth potential.



Who This Role Is For



You are:



• Extremely fluent in English (neutral accent — must sound North American)

• Confident speaking to doctors and nurses

• Familiar with aesthetic medicine / cosmetic injectables

• Comfortable with outbound dials (not afraid of the phone)

• Highly organized and coachable

• Interested in long-term growth into a closing role



HUGE Bonus If You:



• Have worked in cosmetic injectables, dermatology, or med spa space

• Are a Registered Nurse (RN), medical professional, or have injector experience

• Have experience booking high-ticket appointments

• Have worked in HubSpot, Salesmsg, or CRM systems

• Understand Botox, dermal fillers, PRP, cannula techniques, etc.



We do not want someone who has to Google what Botox is.



Your Responsibilities



• Respond to inbound leads via DM and text

• Call new leads within 24 hours

• Pre-qualify medical professionals

• Book discovery calls for our Program Advisor

• Handle light objections (price, travel, timing)

• Follow structured SOP + scripts

• Log all activity inside HubSpot



After 3–6 months (based on performance), you may begin taking discovery calls and earning commission on closed sales.



Who We Train (Important Context)



We only accept licensed healthcare professionals:



• MD / DO

• NP / PA

• RN / RPN / LPN (varies by state/province)

• Dentists

• IMG physicians



You will be speaking to educated, career-driven medical professionals.



What Makes IIAM Different (So You Understand What You’re Selling)



• Hybrid training (online + hands-on on real patients)

• 3–4 students per instructor (very hands-on)

• Accredited in USA & Canada

• Connected to MedSpa Partners (40+ clinics in North America)

• Medical Director Matching Program

• Business & clinic launch support

• 0% financing options available



Our flagship program is the 2-Day Foundations of Aesthetic Medicine (Botox + Filler training). Most leads inquire about this.



Programs range from $3,000–$10,000+.



Compensation



Base salary + performance bonuses



Performance incentives for:

• Calls booked

• Show rate

• Enrollment rate (if you grow into closer role)



This is not a short-term VA position. We are building a serious sales team.



Work Schedule



Must overlap with:

• Eastern Time (USA/Canada)

• Some evenings possible



Full-time preferred.



How to Apply (IMPORTANT)



Send us:



A short Loom video (2–3 minutes) explaining:



Your experience in sales



Your experience in healthcare/aesthetics (if any)



Why you would be a good fit for this role



A voice recording sample (so we can hear your accent)



Your resume



In your application, include the word “Injector” so we know you read this fully.



Final Note



This role is for someone confident, intelligent, and hungry to grow.



If you want a long-term career in high-ticket healthcare sales and possibly move into a closer role — this is for you.



If you’re looking for a basic VA job, this is not it.
