title: Remote Junk Removal Sales Representative
description:
PrimeHaul Junk Removal – Phoenix, AZ



Company Overview



PrimeHaul Junk Removal is a professional, modern junk removal company serving Phoenix, Arizona and the surrounding area. We specialize in high-quality single-item and multi-item junk removal, including furniture, appliances, TVs, shelving, and similar household items.



Our business is built around speed, transparency, and customer satisfaction. We operate a fully remote sales and dispatch model, partnering with independent subcontractors and established junk removal companies to deliver reliable service at scale. This is a long-term operation with plans to expand into additional cities.



?



Job Summary



We are hiring our first full-time Remote Sales Representative / Dispatcher to manage inbound leads, book junk removal jobs, dispatch subcontractors, and oversee jobs from start to finish.



This role combines sales, customer service, and operations. You will be responsible for converting inbound leads into booked jobs, managing fulfillment through Zenbooker, and handling customer issues with professionalism and accountability.



This position is ideal for someone with prior experience in remote sales or dispatching for a blue-collar or home-service business who wants a stable, long-term role with growth opportunity.



?



Key Responsibilities



Sales & Booking

 • Answer inbound phone calls via OpenPhone

 • Respond quickly to inbound leads from booking platforms and online inquiries

 • Book and close junk removal jobs using Zenbooker

 • Clearly explain flat-rate pricing and volume discounts

 • Focus on fast response times, quality bookings, and closing jobs

 • Apply discounts, waive fees, or issue credits when appropriate to close deals or resolve issues



Dispatch & Job Management

 • Manage all jobs inside Zenbooker

 • Dispatch subcontractors using Zenbooker’s auto-assignment and prioritization system

 • Ensure subcontractors receive accurate job details and accept assignments

 • Monitor job progress from booking through completion

 • Communicate with contractors and customers as needed on job day



Customer Service & Issue Resolution

 • Handle cancellations, reschedules, refunds, complaints, and price changes

 • Manage customer concerns professionally and empathetically

 • Follow SOPs to resolve most issues independently

 • Take ownership when mistakes happen and make it right for the customer

 • Escalate only extreme or unsolvable situations



Admin & Systems

 • Maintain accurate records in Google Sheets, Docs, and Drive

 • Follow SOPs, scripts, and workflows consistently

 • Track activity, bookings, and performance metrics

 • Work within Zenbooker as the primary operating system



?



How Our Process Works

 • Customers either book and pay online or call in to book

 • Payment is authorized at booking but not charged until the job is completed

 • Jobs appear in Zenbooker and are offered to subcontractors by location

 • Contractors accept, complete the job, and mark it complete

 • Admin charges the card and an automatic review request
 is sent



You will manage this process end-to-end.



?



Qualifications

 • Prior experience in remote sales, dispatching, or customer service for a home-service or blue-collar business (junk removal, cleaning, moving, etc.)

 • Strong phone communication and sales ability

 • Fast learner who follows SOPs closely

 • Organized, reliable, and detail-oriented

 • Comfortable handling customer issues independently

 • Experience with Zenbooker, Jobber, BookingKoala, Workiz, or similar platforms preferred

 • Comfortable using Google Docs, Sheets, and Drive

 • Able to work consistently during Arizona business hours



?



Training & Ramp-Up

 • Structured onboarding with shadowing

 • Recorded SOPs and walkthroughs

 • Live training and support

 • Expected ramp-up time: 1 week



?



Growth Opportunity



This is a long-term role with significant upside.



As we expand into additional cities:

 • You will help train new hires

 • You can move into a lead dispatcher or operations role

 • Compensation and responsibility will increase with performance



If you help us book more jobs and run operations smoothly, you will be rewarded.



?



How to Apply



Please include:

 • Start it with "JUNK!" To Show You Read This All

 • A short introduction

 • Your experience in remote sales or dispatching

 • Any experience with junk removal or home-service businesses

 • Your Resume

title: Intake Coordinator
description:
The Client Intake Specialist is the critical "first impression" for prospective clients and plays a vital role in the firm's growth by managing and tracking all potential new clients (PNCs). This role is responsible for ensuring a seamless, compassionate, and efficient process from the initial contact through client retention and scheduling the first consultation. This position requires exceptional organizational skills, attention to detail, and a high level of empathy and professionalism.



Key Responsibilities



Lead Management & Tracking:



Serve as the primary point of contact for all incoming leads (phone,
, web forms, walk-ins).

Rigorously track every lead in the firm’s CRM/case management software (e.g., Clio, MyCase) from inquiry to final disposition.

Ensure all data fields related to the lead source, contact information, and case details are accurate and up-to-date.



Client Screening & Vetting:



Conduct initial screening interviews with PNCs to gather necessary factual information about their legal matter.

Determine if the prospective matter aligns with the firm’s practice areas and current capacity.

Perform conflict checks immediately upon intake and document the results.



Communication & Nurturing:



Manage follow-up campaigns 
, phone calls, text messages) to nurture warm leads that have not yet scheduled a consultation.

Clearly and professionally communicate the firm’s scope of services, consultation fees, and required next steps.

Maintain documentation of all communications in the client file.



Scheduling & Conversion:



Efficiently schedule consultations and appointments for attorneys and paralegals.

Prepare and send intake packets, necessary forms, and engagement agreements to prospective clients.

Achieve firm conversion rate goals by consistently following up and moving qualified leads through the pipeline.



Reporting & Analysis:



Generate regular reports on lead volume, lead sources, conversion rates, and pipeline status for firm management.

Identify trends and bottlenecks in the intake process and recommend improvements.



Qualifications

Experience: 2+ years of experience in client intake, sales, customer service, or administrative support, preferably within a law firm or professional services environment.

Technical Skills: Proficiency with CRM or case management software (e.g., Salesforce, Clio, MyCase) and Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel). Experience working with data management spreadsheets is a strong plus.



Soft Skills:



Exceptional phone etiquette and professional communication skills (written and verbal).

High degree of empathy and the ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.

Highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple priorities simultaneously.

Strong self-starter who can work independently and as part of a team.

title: Part-Time Daily Admin Support (Long-Term Role)
description:
This is a small daily admin role that requires attention to detail.

Tasks take only a few minutes per day, and you must be ready to start today if selected.



You will check schedules, confirm clients, post short stories or messages, and create simple Canva visuals.



If the same mistakes continue after instructions are given, this role will not be the right fit. You must have your own computer, stable internet, and the ability to check in every day without reminders. 



Even though the daily work is short, you need free time in your schedule to grow in this role. If your schedule is already full, you will not be able to take more responsibility or earn increases later.



Pay is $50 total per month (monthly pay only).



Pay can increase step by step after consistent and reliable work.

Clear guides, videos, and simple coaching are provided.

This role is best for someone organized and comfortable following a daily routine on their own.



Apply only if you:

- Are ready to start work today if selected (not tomorrow or next week)

- Are reliable and pay close attention to details

- Can follow written instructions and communicate clearly in English

- Are comfortable with steady, repetitive daily tasks

- Do not rely fully on AI instead of your own thinking

- Do not miss details or need reminders

- Do not ask to change pay before showing consistent work

- Have enough free time to grow in the role over time

- Can give this role daily attention

- Are willing to join a short video call if selected



At the end of the application form, write the word BLUE in capital letters in the final question.

Applications without this will not be reviewed.

Ready candidates can start immediately.



Apply here (no DMs):

title: Outbound Enrollment Closer – Career Certification Programs (Remote, EST)
description:
Outbound Enrollment Closer – Career Certification Programs (Remote, EST)



This is not customer service.

This is not inbound order-taking.



This is a phone-driven, outbound enrollment closer role for professionals who know how to control a consult, qualify fast, overcome objections, and close.



We are a U.S.-based online career school enrolling students into IT and Project Management certification programs (CompTIA, PMP, and related tracks). We provide warm leads. You bring the discipline, urgency, and closing skill.



What You’ll Be Doing (Daily Reality)



Make high-volume outbound calls to prospective students



Run structured, consultative enrollment calls (needs analysis ? recommendation ? close)



Control the call, set next steps, and ask for the enrollment



Handle objections around price, time, confidence, and urgency



Follow up relentlessly until the prospect converts or disqualifies



Log activity and outcomes accurately in CRM



Hit daily activity targets and monthly enrollment goals



Improve close rates through coaching, scripts, and call reviews



If you don’t like calling, this role will break you.



Who This Role Is For



Proven outbound / inside sales closers



Comfortable dialing daily and living on the phone



Strong command of English with clear U.S. cultural fluency



Confident asking direct questions and pushing for decisions



Competitive, coachable, metrics-driven



Organized and accountable without supervision



Experience selling education, training, coaching, or professional services is a major plus



Familiarity with certifications (CompTIA, PMP) helps—but closing ability matters more



Bachelor’s degree required



Who Should NOT Apply



Anyone who needs inbound-only leads



Anyone uncomfortable asking for money



Anyone who avoids objection handling



Anyone who wants a “soft” admissions role



Anyone who disappears when targets tighten



Schedule



Monday–Friday



10:00 AM – 6:30 PM EST



Compensation



Base pay: $1,200–$1,600 USD per month



Performance-based advancement and leadership path



Long-term role with stability and growth for performers



(Top performers move fast. Average performers don’t last.)



What You Get



Warm leads with real intent



Clear scripts, frameworks, and coaching



No gimmicks, no fake promises—just real programs that work



A sales culture that rewards results



Bottom Line



If you can:



Control a sales conversation



Build urgency without lying



Close consistently



Take coaching and improve



You will win here.



If not—this role will expose you quickly.

title: Google Ads Specialist
description:
Now Hiring: Experienced Google Ads Specialist

Work-from-Home | U.S.-Based Google Advertising Agency 



We’re a digital marketing agency helping home service businesses (remodelers, roofers, painters, flooring etc.) across the U.S. drive leads and phone calls through highly effective Google Ads campaigns. We’re looking for an experienced Google Ads Specialist from the Philippines to join our team on a full-time basis.



What You’ll Do:  

- Set up Google Ads campaigns from scratch, including structuring ad groups, writing compelling ad copy, and selecting relevant keywords  

- Implement call tracking and Google tracking to measure conversions and optimize campaigns  

- Optimize existing campaigns by analyzing performance data and making adjustments to improve ROI  

- Write high-converting ad copy tailored to contractor clients  

- Create and optimize landing pages for better ad conversion  

- Handle up to 20 Google Ads accounts simultaneously, ensuring each is optimized for performance  

- Monitor, test, and refine campaigns for maximum effectiveness  

- Provide detailed performance reports and recommendations to clients  

- Collaborate with the U.S.-based team to update campaign strategies and ensure client satisfaction



What You Need:  

- 5+ years of experience managing Google Ads campaigns, preferably for home services businesses

- Proficiency in Google Ads setup, campaign management, and optimization  

- Strong understanding of keyword research, ad copywriting, call tracking, Google Analytics, and landing page optimization  

- Experience with landing page creation and conversion optimization  

- Ability to handle 20 accounts at once with attention to detail  

- Excellent English communication skills (both written and spoken)  

- Ability to work independently, stay organized, and manage multiple accounts



Tech Requirements:  

- Reliable internet (10 Mbps minimum)  

- Noise-canceling headset  

- Webcam for Zoo
etings  

- Familiarity with Google Ads, Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, Google Sheets, landing page builders, and other relevant tools



Compensation & Schedule:  

- $1,000/month base pay, plus quarterly performance bonuses 

- Full time: Up to 40 hours per week only  

- Flexibility with hours, but availability during U.S. business hours (CST preferred) is required



How to Apply:  

Please send the following to 
  

1. Your updated resume  

2. A 60 second Loom video introducing yourself, detailing your experience with Google Ads and landing pages, and explaining why you’re a great fit for the role  

3. Any relevant Google Ads campaign results, ad copy, landing pages or case studies you’ve worked on. 





Apply Today, We  Hire Fast!

title: YouTube Operations Manager (Remote) — High Standards, High Output
description:
YouTube Operations Manager (Remote) — Systems, KPIs, SOPs, Team Management



Overview

We run multiple YouTube channels (faceless content). We’re looking for an Operational Manager who treats this like their own business (intrapreneur mindset), moves fast, and holds extremely high standards for anything he or she does.



This is not a “do what you’re told” role. You will be responsible for turning chaos into a machine: planning, execution, tracking, quality control, and team accountability.



What you’ll own

 • Manage the full production pipeline (topic ? script ? edit ? thumbnail ? upload ? QA)

 • Create and enforce SOPs (standard operating procedures) for every recurring process

 • Build and manage KPIs and reporting (weekly performance + production metrics)

 • Ensure deadlines are hit; chase deliverables; remove blockers fast

 • Quality control on outputs (scripts, edits, thumbnails, uploads)

 • Manage freelancers (editors, writers, thumbnail designers): feedback, performance, consistency

 • Keep everything organized in trackers (Notion/Sheets/Trello/ClickUp—your choice, if it works)



What we’re looking for

You are:

 • An intrapreneur: you think in systems, not tasks

 • A workaholic / high-output person (you enjoy building and grinding)

 • Someone who sets the highest standards and refuses to ship “average”

 • Extremely organized and proactive (you don’t wait to be told)

 • Comfortable confronting people on performance (respectful but direct)



Required skills

 • Experience managing workflows or teams (agency, content production, operations, project mgmt)

 • Strong understanding of:

 • SOPs and documentation

 • KPIs (production + performance)

 • Project management tools (Drive/Trello/Sheets)

 • Strong English communication (written + voice)

 • Reliable internet + availability for daily check-ins



Nice to have

 • YouTube automation / faceless channel experience

 • Experience with editors/writers/thumbnail teams

 • Understanding of CTR/AVD/Retention basics



Hours / Availability

 • Remote, long-term

 • Must be highly available and responsive

 • Daily updates required



Compensation

Compensation is determined on the value you bring. When starting off, we'll make sure you can make your ends meet. When (you make) the company grows, you'll salary will grow accordingly, or exponentially.



How to apply (important)

Start your application with: “OPS MACHINE” so we know you read this.



Then include:

 1. Your relevant experience + tools you’ve used (Notion, Sheets, Trello, etc.)

 2. A short example of a SOP you’ve made (or how you’d structure one)

 3. Your availability (hours/day + timezone)

 4. A brief description of how you manage underperformers on a team



Screening process

Shortlisted candidates will do:

 • Personality profile form

 • IQ test

 • Speed test

 • A short live interview + a practical operations scenario

title: Video Editor / Designer for Fast-Growing Jewelry eCommerce Brand
description:
Video Editor / Designer for Fast-Growing Jewelry eCommerce Brand

Company Info + Mission We're a fast-growing D2C jewelry eCommerce brand currently generating $250k/month in revenue, with the goal of scaling to $600k/month in 2026. We sell high-quality lifestyle and jewelry products to customers in the US, Canada, and Europe.



Our mission is simple: deliver great products and create even better customer experiences. We value positive energy, reliability, and treating both our customers and our team like family.



Specific Tasks We are looking for a creative Video Editor / Designer to handle our ad creatives. You will be responsible for editing high-performing eCommerce ads from raw footage, clear ad briefs, and existing B-roll.



Your responsibilities will include:

Video Editing & Production: Edit 2-3 video concepts every week. You must be able to turn existing B-roll footage into creative, cool, and converting ads.



AI Design & Editing: Utilize AI tools to enhance designs, streamline editing, and create unique visual assets.



Ad Optimization: Produce platform-native creatives that follow brand guidelines. You will review ad performance data and iterate on edits to improve results (retention, click-through rate, etc.).



Collaboration: Hop on calls with the team to discuss ad creatives, implement feedback, and proactively suggest improvements.



Requirements & Skills

Experience: 1+ years of experience editing direct-response eCommerce ads.

Visual Skills: Strong understanding of retention and pacing in short-form video ads, with a good eye for high-performing visuals, hooks, and structure. Experience designing in Figma is a plus.



AI Proficiency: Experience with AI design and editing tools is required.

Communication: Fluent written and spoken English.



Work Ethic: Ability to work independently, meet deadlines, and interpret performance metrics to drive creative decisions.

Tech: Reliable and stable internet connection.



What You Can Expect

Full-time position with a supportive international team.

Long-term position with growth opportunities.

Opportunity for pay increases as the business grows.

Regular feedback and a clear workflow structure.



Application Instructions

Please include the word "Apple" in the first sentence of your application so we know you read everything.

Portfolio: Send your portfolio along with your top 3 best-performing ads (video / static). [IMPORTANT - Google drive folder please]

Experience: Include a short summary of your experience (years editing ads, brands worked with, platforms).

AI Tools: Explicitly state which AI tools you have experience with for both editing and designing.



Applications without the keyword will not be considered.

We're excited to meet someone who genuinely cares about quality and wants to grow with us for the long term!

title: Social Media Strategist & Community Growth Manager (Organic Growth | E-commerce Marketing Brand)
description:
About In Flow Marketing

In Flow Marketing is a results-driven
 marketing agency helping Australian product-based e-commerce brands scale from $10K months to $100K+ months using retention and customer lifetime value strategies.



In 2025 alone, we generated:

• $2.5M in client revenue through Klaviyo

• 43% average open rates

• Supported 41 brands

• Grew our team to 3 Klaviyo design specialists



We are strategic, clear, no-fluff, and focused on real revenue growth.

Now, we are ready to expand our organic visibility and personal brand presence across
, Instagram, and Threads.



This is not a content scheduling role.

This is a growth role.



The Role

We are looking for a highly strategic, independent Social Media Strategist & Community Growth Manager to fully own our organic social presence.



You will:

• Develop and execute a growth strategy for
, Instagram, and Threads

• Plan and create weekly content calendars aligned with brand strategy

• Create posts, carousels, reels, captions, and story sequences

• Design graphics in line with brand guidelines

• Drive community engagement and outbound engagement

• Generate qualified followers and inbound leads organically

• Identify trends and strategically apply them

• Track metrics and deliver weekly performance reports

• Continuously test and optimise for engagement and lead generation



This role requires ownership. We do not want to manage you. We want you to manage this channel.



What Success Looks Like

• Consistent, on-brand presence across all platforms

• Measurable follower growth

• Increased engagement rate

• Increased inbound enquiries

• Strong community engagement

• Weekly reporting without being chased



You Are a Good Fit If:

• You have proven experience growing brands organically

• You understand strategy beyond aesthetics

• You can articulate why something works, not just what to post

• You are proactive and self-managed

• You understand e-commerce marketing psychology

• You are comfortable working independently

• You think in terms of business growth, not just content



Bonus (but not required):

• Experience in agency or marketing environments

• Familiarity with Klaviyo and retention marketing

• Understanding of Australian market tone



Deliverables

• Weekly content calendar

• Minimum agreed number of posts per week

• Stories and engagement strategy

• Daily or structured community engagement

• Weekly performance report (growth, engagement, insights, strategy adjustments)



Compensation will be structured as:

• Monthly deliverables fee

• Hourly rate for engagement / outreach



Applicants must quote their hourly rate in AUD.



How to Apply

To be considered, you must complete the application form below.

We will not review CV-only applications.





Thank you so much!

Jess

title: WordPress Technical SEO Specialist Needed (Rank Math + Schema + Core Web Vitals Fixes)
description:
Fix Structured Data, Canonicals, H1 Issues + Improve CWV Performance



Hi! My name is Rhett and I'm the  Marketing Manager at The Equine Practice Company -



I’m looking for an experienced Technical SEO Specialist to help fix several technical issues identified that we have with our website.



The Equine Practice Company - a continuing education platform for equine veterinarians worldwide.



Let me make this very clear before you apply.



- This is not a content role or keyword research role.

- This is a hands-on technical implementation project focused on:



- Structured data (Schema / JSON-LD)

- Entity linking (Organization ? Speakers)

- Canonical + redirect consistency

- Core Web Vitals performance improvements



This is a one-time technical SEO implementation project (I'm estimating 1–2 weeks). I'd prefer a fixed-price structure with clear milestones. If the work is done well, I may offer ongoing technical SEO support for future schema + performance needs to this website and our second website.



I want someone who can fix this properly and document the work clearly. 



A. Current Website Setup



To save time, here is our technical environment:



Website platform: WordPress

Theme: Kadence

SEO plugin: Rank Math

Hosting: WPX (Cloudflare available)

Canonical preference: I don’t mind www vs non-www - I just want one version enforced consistently



Key Tasks



1. Schema & Structured Data Implementation (High Priority) We currently have gaps in structured data, and we need a clean schema setup using best practices.



You will implement:



- Organization schema site-wide

- AboutPage schema

- ContactPage schema + ContactPoint

- Person schema for our “Meet the Speaker” pages

- Proper entity linking (Organization ? Website ? Speakers)



I want a hybrid approach:



- Rank Math for baseline schema

- Custom JSON-LD where needed (especially for Speaker Person schema)



Important: Avoid duplicate/conflicting schema output.



All schema must be validated using:



- Google Rich Results Test

- 
 Validator



2. Homepage SEO Fix (H1 Hierarchy) - Our homepage currently has two H1 tags, which causes structural confusion for Google.



You will:



- Fix the heading hierarchy (single clean H1)

- Keep design intact (Kadence blocks)



Suggested H1:



“The Equine Practice Company – Continuing Education for Equine Veterinarians”



3. Canonical + Domain Consistency (WWW vs Non-WWW) - We may have canonical duplication issues.



You will:



- Audit canonical tags across templates

- Enforce one preferred domain version via proper 301 redirects

- Ensure Rank Math canonicals match server/CDN redirects

- Confirm consistent indexing in Google Search Console



4. Core Web Vitals + Performance Improvements (CWV) - Because this is a membership-based site, performance matters.



I need help improving:



- LCP (Largest Contentful Paint)

- TTFB (Time to First Byte)

- INP / CLS issues if present



You will:



- Identify the top causes of poor CWV (mobile-first)

- Optimize heavy scripts/plugins where possible

- Recommend hosting/CDN improvements if needed



Retest using:



- PageSpeed Insights

- Lighthouse

- CrUX data



It is important that you document before/after results.



Most Importantly, The Final Deliverables (What You Must Provide)



At completion of this project for our website, I expect:



- Working JSON-LD schema for Organization, AboutPage, ContactPage, Person

- Clean entity graph 

- Validation proof (screenshots or links)

- Canonical + redirect mapping summary

- Before/after homepage H1 structure proof

- Core Web Vitals improvement report

- Clear documentation of everything changed



? Screening Questions (Required)



To apply for this task, please answer these:



1. What schema does Rank Math output by default, and how do you avoid duplication when adding custom Person schema?

2. Where would you enforce the canonical domain version (WordPress vs Cloudflare vs server)?

3. Share one example of Organization + Person JSON-LD you have implemented before (client details can be hidden).



Who Is My Ideal Candidate - I'm looking for someone with:



- Strong WordPress technical SEO experience

- Deep schema + JSON-LD knowledge (not just plugins)

- Experience with Rank Math + Kadence themes

- Understanding of Core Web Vitals (TTFB/LCP)

- Ability to work independently and document clearly



Timeline



I want this completed within 7–14 days, depending on scope and testing. If you are a real technical implementer (not just an SEO auditor), I’d love to work with you.



Please apply with your answers to the screening questions and provide me with a fix price to complete this project on our website.

title: Persuasive Copywriter
description:
We’re hiring a full-time Content Marketer to own our content strategy across platforms, with a primary focus on
 marketing (Klaviyo) and website (Shopify). This role is full-time and in-house (remote), so please only apply if you’re looking for a long-term permanent position. We're not hiring freelancer or agency.



This role is ideal for someone who is creative, strategic, and detail-oriented, and excited to work closely with designers to improve content performance through clear insights, testing, and audience-focused messaging.



What You’ll Be Responsible For

- Plan, write, and execute
 campaigns and automated flows in Klaviyo.

- Create and optimize website copy, landing pages, product descriptions, and other on-site content.

- Collaborate with graphic designers to produce visuals aligned with campaigns.

- Analyze
 and website performance metrics to identify what’s working, underperforming content, and opportunities for improvement.

- Participate in brainstorming sessions to improve content and campaign performance.

- Provide insights and recommendations to improve messaging, tone, and overall content effectiveness.

- Analyze website behavior and implement content-driven CRO strategies to improve conversions on landing pages, product pages, and key funnels.

- Monitor competitors’
s, websites, offers, and campaigns to identify gaps or opportunities in our market niche.

- Stay up-to-date with DTC content marketing trends and
 best practices.

- Providing administrative support, as and when needed to the manager.



Requirements

- Full-time, Monday–Friday (9am–5pm PH time)

- Remote position

- Strong writing, editing, and storytelling skills

- Strong analytical and problem-solving skills; able to interpret content performance data to make informed decisions

- Able to explain insights clearly to non-technical teammates

- Highly organized, self-directed, execution-focused, and able to work independently

- Willing to learn quickly and adapt as the business grows

- No prior content marketing experience required, but you must be sharp, creative, analytical, and able to learn fast



Nice To Have (but not required)

- Experience with Klaviyo or other
 marketing platforms

- Experience with Shopify or website analytics

- Experience in content marketing or CRO for DTC brands

- Familiarity with user behavior analytics, heatmaps, or funnel optimization

- Basic understanding of SEO and social media content strategy



What We Offer

- Competitive salary

- Performance-based bonuses

- Paid annual leave & public holidays

- Fully remote work

- Training, upskilling, and career growth opportunities

- A team that values ownership, clarity, and results



Application

Please send your application via
 to 
 with the subject line: "Persuasive Copywriter – (Your Name)". Include your OnlineJobsPH profile link and answers to the questions below in numbered format directly in the
 body:

1) Tell us about your most recent job. What did you mainly work on, what were some challenges you faced, and why did you d
 to leave?

2) If you’ve worked in
 marketing/copywriting, tell us about the campaigns you handled, tools you used, your process, and results. If you haven’t, what have you been learning on your own and how would you get competent quickly?

3) Share a time you took initiative or solved a problem in your workplace. It doesn’t have to be a formal leadership role, just something you’re proud of.

4) Please submit as much of your portfolio as possible. Submitting more work will help us make a more informed decision. Work can include anything within DTC e-commerce industry, but ideally aligned to the role you are applying for. If you don’t have DTC experience, submit your best work portfolio. Strong portfolios outside this role may be considered for other roles. 

5) Pick one project from the attached portfolio in question (4) that you are most proud of and answer the questions below. We want to see your ability to clearly explain what you did, your role, your reasoning, and the results of your work. You may optionally pick more than 1 project to highlight additional skills.

- What the project was

- Your specific contribution

- Why you approached it this way

- The results or impact (if any)



Keywords

creative copywriter, creative copywriting, DTC, CRM, SEO, copywriter, e-commerce copywriter, sales conversion, content writing, direct response copywriting, persuasive copywriting, performance ads, lifecycle marketing, retention marketing,
 copywriter, copy strategy, sales funnel, marketing strategist, copy strategist,
 strategist,
 specialist, copy specialist, sales copywriter, website copywriting, klaviyo, mailchimp, omnisend, performance marketing, postscript, SMS marketing, brand strategist, CRO, landing page, web copy,
 copywriting,
 marketing,
 lifecycle management,
 lifecycle strategy

title: Senior Meta Ads Specialist / Performance Marketing Engineer (Remote / Full Time)
description:
Job Title: Senior Meta Ads Specialist / Performance Marketing Engineer (Remote / Full Time)



Company: 



Who We Are

At GMU.online, we build scalable, managed SaaS solutions that engineer profitable and predictable growth for e-commerce entrepreneurs. We don't just run ads; we automate the entire performance marketing loop, from product data feeds and catalog management to cross-channel campaign optimization, through our own proprietary platform. We enable high volume web shops to focus on their product while our technology stack systematically maximizes their return on ad spend.



Your Role: Architect of Meta Performance

We are looking for a Senior Meta Ads Specialist (8+ years experience) who functions as a Performance Marketing Engineer. This is not a "launch and monitor" role. You are a hands on performance architect who will own, dissect, and scale our clients' Meta and other social advertising results. You combine deep technical execution in the Meta ecosystem with a datadriven mindset for automation, relentlessly building smarter configurations that outperform standard campaigns.



You will work at the intersection of paid social and data science, leveraging our proprietary Data Engine and Feed Automation Systems to turn complex ecommerce data into a competitive advantage on
, Instagram, Tiktok and other social ads platforms.



Your Technical Arena: What You'll Build & Optimize

1. Meta Ads Engineering & Structure



Full Funnel Architecture: Design and manage complex, high-volume campaign structures beyond basic CBO’s. You'll architect multi-layered prospecting, retargeting, and dynamic product ad (DPA) strategies that align with the customer journey.



Advanced Bidding & Automation: Mastery of Meta's bidding algorithms (Value Optimization, Cost Cap, Bid Cap) to hit strict ROAS/POAS targets. You will use automated rules and external scripts to manage bid adjustments, budget pacing, and alerting at scale.



2. E-commerce Data & Catalog Mastery



 Catalog & Feed Management: You don't just upload a feed; you optimize it. Deep experience with tools like Channable, Feedonomics, or DataFeedWatch to improve product data specifically for Meta. You leverage custom labels to create granular product segmentation (e.g., by margin, sell-through rate, seasonality) directly within the catalog.



Dynamic Product Ads (DPA) Strategy: You build sophisticated DPA sets that dynamically show the right product to the right user based on their browsing behavior, purchase history, and real-time inventory levels. You understand how to structure product sets for maximum relevance and conversion.



3. Conversion Tracking & Measurement Infrastructure



Server-Side Tracking & CAPI: You have deep knowledge of implementing and troubleshooting Meta's Conversions API (CAPI) . You understand how to set up deduplication between the browser pixel and server-side events to ensure data integrity in a cookieless world.



Tag Management (GTM): You are highly proficient in Google Tag Manager, configuring complex dataLayer variables, custom triggers, and advanced e-commerce tracking to feed clean, granular conversion data back to Meta for optimization.



Attribution & Incrementality: You move beyond last-click. You analyze attribution windows, understand the impact of view-through vs. click-through conversions, and can design holdout tests to measure the true incrementality of Meta campaigns.



4. Automation & Workflow Efficiency



Scripts & Integrations: You are comfortable using scripts and APIs to automate reporting and consolidate data fro
ta, Webshops and Google Analytics 4 into a single source of truth.



AI-Driven Optimization: You leverage AI co-pilots for ad copy generation, creative testing concepts, and predictive forecasting. You are curious about how LLMs can automate audience analysis and campaign brief generation.



We’re looking for:

Experience: 8-10+ years of hands-on experience specifically in Meta Ads 
/Instagram) + other paid social performance marketing for e-commerce.



ROAS/POAS Optimization: A proven track record of optimizing not just for ROAS, but for Profit on Ad Spend (POAS) , managing bids based on product-level margin data.



Data Fluency: You are comfortable querying data in Google Analytics 4 (GA4) to build audiences, analyze user behavior, and validate tracking. You can translate raw e-commerce data (SQL knowledge is a plus) into actionable audience and bidding strategies. You know how to connect datalayers to Google Tag Manager.



Ownership & Strategy: You don't just execute tasks; you own the growth trajectory. You proactively identify scaling opportunities, diagnose performance anomalies, and present data-backed strategies to internal teams and international clients.



Innovation Culture: You dedicate time to R&D, testing new Meta betas, AI creative tools, and audience modeling techniques and share your findings to elevate the entire team's knowledge.



Your Technical Toolkit

Core Platforms: Meta Business Suite (Ads Manager, Business Manager, Events Manager), Google Analytics 4 (GA4), Google Tag Manager (GTM).



Feed & Catalog: Channable, Feedonomics, DataFeedWatch, or native
 Catalog setup with custom labels.



Tracking & Measurement: Conversions API (CAPI) , Server-Side Tagging, Google Sheets (for data analysis), Looker Studio (for dashboards).



Automation: Google Ads Scripts, Supermetrics/Power My Analytics, API integrations for data flow.



AI & Innovation: Practical application of generative AI (e.g., Midjourney for creative inspiration, ChatGPT for copy at scale) and machine learning concepts for audience forecasting.



What Sets You Apart (Bonus Points)

Multi-Platform Synergy: Experience integrating Meta strategies with other channels (e.g., TikTok, Pinterest, Google PMax) for a holistic view.



Machine Learning Knowledge: Understanding of how ML models power bidding and how to structure campaigns to feed them optimal data.



International Scale: Proven success scaling Meta ads across multiple currencies, languages, and time zones for global e-commerce brands.



Why Join GMU.online?

Work with the Best: Collaborate with senior developers, data scientists, and marketers in a flat, high-performance culture.



Cutting-Edge Tech: Access and help build proprietary martech that delivers an average client ROI of 900%.



Ultimate Ownership: Full responsibility and freedom to design creative, data-driven solutions without bureaucratic red tape.



R&D Time: Dedicated time for innovation 20% of your focus can be on experimenting with new tech and strategies.



Global Collaboration: Work remotely in an async-first environment with international entrepreneurs. We value clear communication and structured ownership over micromanagement.



Ready to engineer the future of e-commerce performance? Apply now.

title: HEALTHCARE OPERATIONS SPECIALIST
description:
(WellSky Required – Internal Operations Focus)



Location: Remote 

Position: Full-Time

Industry: U.S. Non-Medical Home Care Agency



We are a growing home care agency serving seniors and adults. We are seeking an experienced Healthcare Virtual Assistant with strong WellSky proficiency to support internal daily operations.



This role focuses on scheduling, compliance, caregiver coordination, payroll verification, and recruiting support — not sales.



Applicants must have hands-on WellSky experience.







Core Responsibilities



WellSky Operations (Primary Responsibility)



• Manage caregiver & client profiles

• Real-time scheduling and shift adjustments

• Fill urgent call-outs

• Monitor caregiver attendance

• Generate reports (hours worked, visit completion, payroll review)

Client workflows

Ongoing dispute management

Procedural

Credit repair SOPs



Letter templates



Dispute workflows

title: Full-Time Virtual Assistant (High Ownership | Launch & Marketing Support)
description:
Virtual Assistant (Full-Time | 30–40 Hours/Week)

Extreme Ownership | Growth-Minded | Mission-Driven



Ready to Be More Than “Just a VA”?



At Felicia Reed Photography & Coaching, we empower women to step into bold confidence and self-worth through luxury photography, transformative coaching, and live events. We’re searching for a high-performing Virtual Assistant who wants to grow a career—not just work a job. If you thrive on ownership, crave systems, and want to make a real impact, we want to meet you!



Who We Want



You take 100% ownership—no excuses.

You love learning, crave feedback, and always raise the bar.

You’re tech-savvy AND people-focused.

You want to help build something bigger than yourself.

This is NOT for you if you:



Need constant reminders or supervision.

Resist feedback or change.

Want a short-term, side gig, or “easy” work.

Aren’t passionate about women’s empowerment.

What You’ll Do



Daily

Organize and zero out the inbox—always professional.

Respond swiftly and warmly to clients and leads.

Maintain CRM/client records.

Follow up with clients, leads, and vendors.

Schedule sessions, meetings, and live events.

Liaise with marketing and sales.





Weekly

Draft and publish newsletters/blogs.

Maintain ongoing client communications.

Design lead magnets/freebies in Canva.

Set up Flodesk campaigns and automations.

Build/edit workflows and landing pages (Podia, Showit).

Track KPIs and submit weekly metrics.

Join leadership Zoom huddles.



Monthly

Support coaching launches and masterclasses.

Build sales pages (Podia) and manage event logistics.

Update
/webinar sequences.

Create presentations for speaking engagements.

Lead performance reviews and metrics debriefs.

Media & Visibility Outreach



Research and pitch Felicia for podcasts, TV, online publications, events, and panels.

Send 50 custom pitches weekly; maintain an outreach tracker.

Follow up on all pitches and report outcomes.

Live Launch/Event Support



Moderate live Zoom sessions (admit, engage, troubleshoot).

Timestamp Q&A, track attendance, upload replays.

Handle post-event communications and fulfillment.

Capture launch metrics.



Tools You’ll Use or Master:

Canva, Notion, Loom, Zoom (moderator level), Podia, Flodesk, GoHighLevel, Showit, Google Workspace, Basic Photoshop





Traits We Value

Fiercely self-motivated and independent

Systems-obsessed and detail-oriented

Fast learner and agile problem-solver

Excellent English (written and spoken)

People-focused and growth-driven

Proud to represent a mission-driven brand

What Success Looks Like



Inbox is organized and zeroed out daily.

Every client feels supported and followed up with.

Launches/events run seamlessly; metrics are tracked.

Systems improve every week.

You “own it”—and leadership trusts you.

You feel valued, energized, and empowered.



Growth Path

Opportunities to advance in Operations, Project Management, Launch/Event Management, Marketing, Client Experience, and Team Leadership.



We invest in your skills, leadership, and vision.



Why Join Us?

Long-term, stable position—not “just a gig”

Weekly mentorship and real autonomy

Team that treats you as a business partner

Purposeful, high-impact work

Respect, challenge, and a true seat at the table

How to Apply (Read Carefully!)



 your application to 
 with subject line:

Your Next VA: [Your Name]



In your
, include:

A brief introduction and your background

What you do best as a Virtual Assistant

Why you’re the perfect fit for our mission and team

Bonus: Use the word IMPACT somewhere in your
.



Applications that do not follow these instructions will not be considered.

title: Social Media Coordinator
description:
About That Stay (ATS) is a boutique short-term rental management and marketing company based in Ontario, Canada.



We manage curated, design-forward vacation rentals including luxury cottages, lakehouses, and cabins. Our brand focuses on elevated positioning, strong storytelling, and premium guest experience.



We are growing quickly and looking for a creative, strategic, and detail-oriented Social Media Manager to take our social presence to the next level. This role is not just about posting content — it’s about building authority, trust, and brand recognition.



Your Role



You will manage and grow our social media presence across Instagram and
, with potential expansion into TikTok.

Your primary goal is to position ATS as a trusted, premium brand in vacation rental management and curated stays.



Responsibilities



- Create monthly content calendars aligned with brand strategy

- Develop content pillars such as owner education, guest inspiration, authority positioning, and behind-the-scenes

- Write strong, polished captions in a premium, confident tone

- Repurpose existing photo and video content into reels and carousels

- Edit short-form videos using tools such as CapCut or Canva

- Design clean, minimal graphics in Canva

- Research hashtags, and other techniques that support organic growth

- Engage with relevant accounts and support community building

- Track analytics and provide monthly performance reports

- Suggest improvements based on results



Required Skills



- Excellent written English (very important)

- Strong understanding of Instagram strategy

- Canva proficiency

- Basic video editing skills

- Organized and detail-oriented

- Able to follow brand guidelines

- Reliable internet connection and equipment



Bonus (Not Required but a Plus)



- Experience working with North American clients

- Experience with short-term rentals, hospitality, real estate, or luxury brands preferred



Personality We’re Looking For



Proactive and solution-oriented

Strategic thinker, not just task-based

Creative but structured

Professional and polished

Interested in a long-term role and growing with the company



We are looking for someone for part-time 8-10 hours a week or so.



To Apply



Please include:

A short introduction about yourself

Links to social accounts you have managed/Portfolio

2–3 sample captions you would write for a luxury cottage brand

Your resume

Your availability (hours per week)

title: ELITE VIDEO EDITOR WANTED FOR 7-FIGURE ECOMMERCE BRAND (AI + Direct Response)
description:
Hey there,



My team and I are looking for a highly skilled Video Editor to join our fast-growing 7-figure eCommerce brand.



We’ve built our success primarily on high-converting image ads, and now we’re transitioning aggressively into video ads.



We are looking for someone who can take our proven winning angles and transform them into powerful, emotional, direct-response video creatives.



This is not just a “cut clips together” role.



This is a key growth position inside the company.



We serve primarily older demographics (40–70 years old) in Western markets. Our ads focus on:



- Health concerns

- Dust, mold, allergies

- Home safety

- Long-term wellbeing

- Protection of family



This means:



- We do NOT need fast TikTok-style editing

- We need strong storytelling

- Clear messaging

- Emotional pacing

- Direct response structure



# ROLE



You are responsible for turning proven angles into high-converting video ads.



You ensure every video:



- Has a strong hook (first 3 seconds)

- Communicates a clear desire

- Uses direct response principles

- Is structured for performance marketing

- Matches our older target audience



You will work directly with the CEO and creative team.



# RESPONSIBILITIES



- Edit video ads for
 & Instagram

- Turn winning image concepts into video formats

- Use AI tools for visual generation when needed

- Generate new creative ideas and angles

- Improve scripts visually with pacing & structure

- Create multiple variations of ads for testing

- Contribute creative ideas during team discussions



# REQUIREMENTS



You MUST:



- Have experience editing direct-response video ads

- Understand basic direct response principles (hooks, problem-agitate-solution, UGC structure, testimonials, authority angles, etc.)

- Have experience with AI tools:

    - Higgsfield or similar image generation models (NanoBanana Pro is a big plus)

    - Video generation models like Veo3, Kling, or Sora 2

- Have a strong understanding of emotional pacing

- Be able to work independently

- Have a reliable laptop/computer setup

- Have fast and stable internet

- Be fluent in English



Big PLUS:



- Experience in health/home-related products

- Ability to suggest new concepts and creative angles

- Strong marketing intuition



# RESULTS WE EXPECT



- 3–5 high-quality video ads per week (depending on complexity)

- Constant improvement in structure and storytelling

- Contribution of new ideas to the creative team

- Proactive communication



# COMPENSATION STRUCTURE



- Starting at $10/hour

- 2-week paid trial period

- Performance bonuses based on winning ads

- Pay increases over time based on performance and reliability

- Possibility to move into part-time or full-time position after we build trust and consistent workflow



# IMPORTANT



When applying, please:

1. Send examples of your best video ads (preferably performance-based ads).

2. Tell us if you have experience with Higgsfield or other image generation models.

3. Tell us if you have experience with video generation models such as Veo3, Kling, or Sora 2.

4. Explain what you believe makes a video ad convert.

5. If you have read this whole job post, please include the word “AI” somewhere at the end of your application for additional points.



We are building a long-term team.



We want someone who wants to grow with us and contribute beyond just editing.



If you are creative, disciplined, and serious about performance marketing, this could become a strong long-term opportunity.



Looking forward to your application.



— Kacper Jegier

title: Lead Generation Specialist
description:
At Keswick Holdings, we are dedicated to creating affordable housing through the acquisition and transformation of mobile home and RV communities into safe, comfortable living spaces. We believe in aligning each person with work that matches their strengths and encouraging ongoing growth, self-awareness, and improvement. At Keswick Holdings, you’ll be part of a mission-driven team that values integrity, personal development, and meaningful impact. Whether you're building new systems, solving real housing challenges, or growing into your potential, your work here truly matters.



Who We Are and What We Are Looking For…

 Keswick Holdings is a small, close-knit team of dedicated professionals committed to doing meaningful work that changes lives. We are ambitious and always pushing to grow, both individually and as a company. To keep building on that 
ntum, we’re looking for a driven and resourceful Lead Generation Specialist to join our team. This role is key to helping us stay sharp, organized, and focused as we grow our mission of creating safe, affordable housing. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, love the challenge of turning cold leads into real opportunities, and want to be part of a team that values growth and ownership, we want to hear from you.



Role Description:

 The Lead Generation Specialist is responsible for identifying and engaging potential sellers, maintaining our CRM, and supporting daily outreach and operational tasks. This role is ideal for someone who is proactive, people-focused, and thrives in a dynamic, fast-paced environment.



Key Responsibilities/Objectives:



- RV Ownership Research and Lead Identification: Use skip tracing tools and systems to locate and gather ownership information for RVs, identifying key decision-makers and potential leads.

- Outbound Sales and Lead Engagement: Conduct cold calls, send outreach
s, and follow up with leads to build interest and move prospects through the sales pipeline.

- CRM Management and Follow-Up: Maintain and organize leads within our CRM system (GoHighLevel), including tagging, tracking communication, and ensuring timely follow-ups.

- Administrative Coordination and Support: Assist with general administrative tasks including scheduling and posting pre-prepared content to social media





Who you are:

- Outgoing, emotionally intelligent, and a natural conversationalist

- A self-starter with strong initiative and resourcefulness

- Compassionate, with excellent tonality and rapport-building skills

- Open to feedback, adaptable, and eager to learn and grow

- Comfortable using AI tools and navigating changing environments

- Jack of all trades with a flexible, roll-up-your-sleeves mindset



Who you are not:

- Someone who is consistently negative and complains

- Someone who makes excuses

- Someone who is unable to be accountable for your results

- Someone who lacks emotional intelligence or is hypersensitive to feedback and rejection



Must-Have Qualifications:

- Proven experience as a Virtual Assistant (VA)

- At least 6 months of experience in cold calling or phone-based outreach

- Strong time management and organizational skills

- Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written



Nice-to-Have Qualifications:

- Experience using GoHighLevel as a CRM and workflow tool

- 2 or more years of experience in cold calling or outbound sales outreach

title: Engineer / Technical Operations Focus
description:
About Us

Horseshoe Housing supplies fully furnished apartments for short- and medium-term stays through Airbnb, VRBO, and related booking platforms. As we scale, we’re hiring a technically strong teammate to help manage platform operations, integrations, and data-driven optimization across our listings.

This role is ideal for engineers or technically trained professionals who enjoy working at the intersection of systems, data, and real-world operations.

Schedule

10 hours/day, 6 days/week (60 hours/week)



What You’ll Do

Platform & listing operations:

Manage and optimize listings across Airbnb, VRBO, and related channels, ensuring data consistency, pricing accuracy, availability, and performance.





Integrations & automation:

Work with APIs, channel managers, PMS tools, and internal systems to support listing synchronization, messaging workflows, pricing updates, and reporting pipelines.





Technical issue coordination:

Diagnose and coordinate resolution of platform-related issues (sync errors, calendar mismatches, pricing bugs, messaging failures) with internal teams and vendors.





Lead & guest communication:

 and call warm leads and current guests, using structured, professional communication when technical or operational issues arise.





Reporting & analytics:

Maintain revenue trackers, performance dashboards, KPIs, and end-of-month reports using Excel and other tools.







Ideal Background

We are not looking for prior Airbnb or hospitality experience.

This role is strongly suited for:

Engineers (software, systems, data, industrial, or similar)





Computer science or technical degree holders





Candidates comfortable thinking in workflows, systems, and edge cases





Requirements

Bachelor’s degree (Engineering, Computer Science, or similar preferred)





Strong understanding of APIs, data flows, and system integrations



Strong English (written & spoken)





Ability to troubleshoot technical issues methodically







What We Value

Systems thinking and structured problem-solving





Comfort working with imperfect tools and real-world constraints





Ability to document processes and improve them over time





Ownership mentality — identifying issues before they become problems





Clear technical and non-technical communication







Compensation & Growth

Rate: $850 USD / month





Long-term role with increased responsibility for high performers





Opportunity to take ownership of listing infrastructure, integrations, and automation workflows







What Helps You Succeed

Confidence communicating with internal teams and external platforms





Detail-oriented, process-driven mindset





Stable internet connection (200 Mbps+)





Fast learner with new tools, dashboards, and APIs







Interview Process

During the interview, you can expect:

English proficiency assessment





Behavioral interview







Discussion around systems thinking, workflows, and troubleshooting approach





???? If you’ve read this far, please include “bnb” in your subject line and at the end of your application write any experiences you have ever had with Airbnb weather that being you stayed at one before or a family member hosts airbnbs.

title: Elite Real Estate Marketing & Social Media Virtual Assistant (Content Strategy, Brand Growth, CRM & Client Experience)
description:
ABOUT THE ROLE



We are hiring a high-level Virtual Assistant to help grow and elevate a top-producing real estate brand in the Seattle / Pacific Northwest market.



This is not a basic posting role. We are looking for someone who can think strategically, bring creative ideas, and help scale a modern real estate brand that blends luxury, lifestyle, design, and relationship-driven business.



You should understand personal branding, know how to create engaging content, and help the agent stay visible, relevant, and differentiated in a crowded market.



If you bring ideas, think like a marketer, and want to help build a standout brand — this is for you.



WHAT WE’RE REALLY LOOKING FOR

 • Someone who studies what works and brings fresh ideas

 • Someone who can help content feel modern, elevated, and human

 • Someone who understands how to grow followers and engagement organically

 • Someone who wants to help build a recognizable personal brand

CORE RESPONSIBILITIES

, LinkedIn, and Google Business

 • Educational content

 • Behind-the-scenes 
nts

 • Market insights

 • Lifestyle and design content

 • Suggest strong hooks, captions, and formats that perform well

 • Help create content with viral potential (while staying on-brand)



3) Canva Design & Visual Brand

 • Create polished, modern graphics including:

 • Social posts and reel covers

 • Listing visuals

 • Market updates

 • Client events and campaigns

 • Maintain a clean, cohesive aesthetic

 • Organize and evolve brand templates over time



4) CRM & Relationship Systems

 • Maintain and organize CRM/database including:

 • Past clients

 • Vendors and partners

5) Client Experience & Reputation

 • Support thoughtful client touch systems:

 • Birthday reminders

 • Outreach lists

 • Relationship-based follow-ups



6)
, Systems & Light Operations

 • Organize inbox and flag important messages

 • Draft simple templates when needed

 • Help protect the agent’s time and focus

 • Support simple systems that improve consistency and organization



7) Website & Brand Presence

 • Help keep website current and aligned with brand

 • Ensure consistency across:

 • Website

 • Social platforms

 •
 branding

 • Marketing materials



IDEAL CANDIDATE

 • Strong experience in social media management including You Tube (real estate preferred)

 • Understands personal branding and content strategy

 • Brings ideas, not just execution

 • Comfortable suggesting new approaches

 • Strong Canva skills and a great design eye

 • Familiar with CRMs (Follow Up Boss, KVCore, etc.)

 • Highly organized and proactive

 • Excellent written communication

 • Understands relationship-driven businesses

 • Can balance creativity with professionalism



BIG BONUS IF YOU:

 • Love studying content trends

 • Have helped accounts grow significantly

 • Enjoy storytelling and brand building

 • Understand luxury or design-forward aesthetics

 • Have ideas for modern real estate marketing

 • Think like a content strategist, not just a VA



HOURS & OPPORTUNITY

 • Part-time to start with room to grow

 • Long-term opportunity for the right person

 • Flexible structure for a high-performer

 • Compensation based on experience and creativity

title: Social Media Content Strategist & Editor (Family and Insurance Law Firm)
description:
We’re building two high-energy law firm channels and need a creative content strategist who lives and breathes short-form video. You’ll pitch 2–3 scroll-stopping ideas per day, edit the videos we film, write captions/hashtags, and either deliver files for posting or publish directly (with account access). If you know what news cycles pop and can spot a trend before it peaks, let’s talk.

What you’ll do

• Own the content calendar: Plan 14–21 posts/week across TikTok, IG Reels, YouTube long form and YouTube Shorts.

• Pitch daily concepts: Hooks, on-screen text, shot lists, B-roll ideas, trending sounds.

• Edit for thumb-stop: Tight cuts, subtitles, beat-matched transitions; deliver vertical 9:16.

• Write to convert: Captions, hashtags, CTAs; optimize for search & saves.

• Post & optimize: Schedule/publish, pin comments, A/B test hooks/cover frames.

• Trend intelligence: Track weekly trends/sounds; adapt them to legal content.

• Measure & iterate: Report weekly on retention, watch time, saves, shares, and growth; propose experiments.

You’re a fit if you have

• 2+ years creating and editing short-form video for TikTok/IG/Shorts with proven growth wins.

• Strong editing chops in CapCut, Premiere Pro, or Final Cut; fast subtitling & cut-to-beat skills.

• Clear point of view on hooks, storytelling, and algorithm-friendly packaging.

• Research instincts: you can surface creative, unique content ideas and validate them with data.

• Process-driven reliability: organized files, consistent naming, templates, and deadlines.

Tools you use (or will)

CapCut/Premiere • TikTok Creative Center • Google Drive • Notion/Trello • Canva/Photoshop (thumbnails/covers) • Later/Buffer (scheduling)

Success looks like (first 90 days)

• Consistent output of 14–21 posts/week/brand with less than 2s hook intros.

• Average view duration trending upward; save/share rate improving weekly.

• At least 3 trend experiments/week; clear learnings documented.

• A repeatable content system (calendar, templates, asset library).

Work style

• Remote with America/New York time zone overlap for quick approvals.

• Contractor or part-time to start; path to expanded hours based on performance.

• Compensation: Competitive/DOE with performance incentives.

How to apply (please follow exactly)

1. Resume: Include relevant experience

2. Portfolio: Links to 3–5 TikTok/Reel edits you personally strategized + edited (call out your role).

3. Quick brief: 5 post ideas for “powerful but wearable rose scents” (titles + one-line hook + suggested sound).

4. Trend snapshot: 3 trending sounds you’d use this week and how you’d adapt them to relevant legal content.

5. Tools & availability: Your editing tools, typical turnaround time, and weekly hours available.

6. Rate: Hourly or monthly retainer preference.

If you’re equal parts creative director, editor, and trend detective—and you love the law —this is your playground.

title: Construction Estimator/Drafter
description:
We’re looking for a technically skilled and detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to join our team at Red Branch Outdoor Living. This full-time role is perfect for someone with experience in construction-related drawings, sales support, and CRM systems like Buildertrend. If you thrive in a fast-paced, highly organized environment and want to contribute to a company that builds dream backyards, this is your opportunity.



What You’ll Be Doing:

-Sales & Proposal Support – Assist our sales team by building estimates and proposals in Buildertrend with clarity and accuracy.

-2D/3D Project Drawings – Create and edit project drawings using SketchUp or similar tools for decks, pavilions, kitchens, and more.

-Engineering Coordination – Prepare conceptual drawings and coordinate with engineers to ensure compliance with local codes.

-Shop Drawing Development – Produce detailed build-ready shop drawings for construction crews to follow on-site.

-File & Documentation Management – Keep all drawings and documents properly named, organized, and accessible for the entire team.



What We’re Looking For:

-Strong Drafting Skills – Proficient in SketchUp (or similar), able to produce 3D concepts and accurate shop drawings.

-Construction Understanding – Familiar with how outdoor structures like decks and pavilions go together.

-Sales Process Supporter – Comfortable entering takeoffs, pricing, and scope items into a CRM (Buildertrend experience is a plus).

-Detail-Oriented & Organized – You’ll be handling project-critical drawings and proposals—precision matters.

-Collaborative Communicator – Able to work closely with salespeople, engineers, and field teams remotely.

-Permitting Awareness – Understanding how city codes and permitting might impact a project is a bonus.



Why Join Red Branch?

-Fully Remote – Work from anywhere while making an impact on custom outdoor living projects.

-High Impact Role – Your work directly helps us win clients and execute projects with excellence.

-Growth Opportunities – As our company grows, so can your responsibilities and compensation.

-Positive, Purpose-Driven Culture – We build beautiful spaces, but more importantly, we’re building something meaningful together.



If you’re ready to combine your technical skills, drawing talent, and construction know-how to support a growing team, we’d love to hear from you!



****Apply by submitting an application through the link below.*****

title: Paid Media Performance Strategist
description:
About Brand Bros Co.



Brand Bros Co. is a full-service Branding, Marketing, and Public Relations agency built on strategy, creativity, and measurable execution. We partner with growth-focused businesses to build brands people recognize, trust, and choose — through integrated brand development, paid media, and strategic communications.



We are not looking for a junior ads manager.



We are hiring a highly experienced Paid Media Performance Strategist who can take full ownership of paid advertising performance across multiple client accounts — with zero training required.



Role Overview

This role is responsible for planning, executing, optimizing, and scaling paid digital campaigns across Google and Meta platforms, while strategically integrating
 marketing to support full-funnel performance.



You will own:

- Performance strategy

- Budget allocation

- Tracking implementation

- Conversion optimization

- Reporting & insights

-
 marketing integration

- Client communication



This is a high-trust, high-accountability role. You must be confident operating independently and making strategic decisions without oversight. If you require hand-holding or ongoing training, this is not the right fit.



Paid Media Strategy & Execution:

- Plan, launch, and manage campaigns across:

- Google Ads (Search, Display, YouTube)

- Google Local Service Ads

- Meta Ads 
 & Instagram)

- Strong preference for candidates with experience in:

- LinkedIn Ads

- OTT platforms

- Geofencing

- Multi-location campaigns

- You must have independently managed live budgets and made optimization decisions based on performance data — not theory.



Performance & Revenue Accountability

You are not managing ads. You are managing results. You will be responsible for:

- Cost per lead (CPL)

- Return on ad spend (ROAS)

- Conversion rate optimization

- Lead quality improvement

- Scaling winning campaigns

- You must be able to identify underperformance and implement corrective strategy quickly and independently.



Advanced Tracking & Attribution

You must be fully comfortable implementing and managing:

- Google Analytics 4

- Google Tag Manager

- Meta Pixel & Conversion API (CAPI)

- Enhanced Conversions (Google)

- UTM tracking structures

- Offline conversion imports

- CRM attribution workflows

- Retargeting strategy implementation

- Experience with call tracking platforms (ex: CallRail) is a plus.

- If you do not understand attribution, conversion tracking, and data accuracy, this role is not a fit.



 Marketing Integration (Mailchimp or Similar Platforms)

You will strategically integrate
 marketing into paid media funnels to improve conversion rates and lifetime value.

Responsibilities may include:

- Building and managing campaigns in Mailchimp (or similar platforms)

- Developing nurture and remarketing sequences aligned with paid campaigns

- List segmentation and audience targeting strategy

- Performance tracking and optimization of
 campaigns

- Supporting automated workflows that connect paid ads and CRM systems

-
 marketing in this role is performance-driven — not administrative.



Automation & Systems

You will build and manage automation systems using:

- Zapier

- CRM integrations

- Lead routing workflows

- Reporting automations

- We are building scalable systems. You must think in terms of process and efficiency.



Landing Pages & Conversion Optimization

Strong understanding of:

- Landing page strategy

- Offer positioning

- Creative testing

- Funnel optimization

- A/B testing frameworks

- Ads are only part of the equation. You must understand the full conversion funnel.



Creative Development

You must be capable of:

- Designing static ad creative independently

- Developing high-converting copy angles

- Testing hooks and messaging variations

- Creating simple motion assets (preferred)

- You do not need to be a designer — but you must be competent enough to execute without waiting on others.



Client Communication

This is a client-facing role. You must be able to:

- Explain performance clearly

- Communicate insights confidently

- Make strategic recommendations

- Defend decisions with data

- Strong written and spoken English is mandatory.



Non-Negotiable Requirements

- 4+ years managing paid digital campaigns independently

-Proven experience managing monthly budgets of $5,000+ USD per account

- Advanced proficiency in Google Ads, Google Local Service Ads, and Meta Ads

- Hands-on experience with GA4 and GTM

- Experience implementing tracking pixels and retargeting strategies

- Experience using Zapier for workflow automation

- Experience managing performance-driven
 campaigns (Mailchimp or similar)

- Strong analytical thinking and problem-solving ability

- Fully fluent English communication skills****

- Reliable high-speed internet



Availability

Must be available 9:00 AM – 3:00 PM EST Monday, Wednesday, and Friday. Additional flexibility outside those hours is a plus.



Compensation

This is a remote position based in the Philippines. Compensation will be very competitive based on experience and skill level. Performance-based incentives will absolutely be offered for strong results.



How to Apply

: 



Include:

- Resume

- Portfolio or examples of campaigns you’ve managed

- Screenshots of performance dashboards (redact sensitive info)

- Explanation of budgets you’ve managed

- Screenshot of internet speed

- Confirmation of availability (9:00 AM – 3:00 PM EST, Monday/Wednesday/Friday)



Selected candidates will complete a short paid skills assessment involving a campaign audit and optimization recommendations, and interviews via Zoom.

title: Motion Designer (Dan Koe/Minimalist Animation Style)
description:
We are looking for a creative and disciplined Motion Designer to transform complex ideas into visually stunning, minimalist animated reels. The goal is to produce content that mirrors the "Dan Koe" aesthetic: clean lines, purposeful movement, grit textures, and a focus on high-level concepts (business, mindset, and productivity).



What You’ll Be Doing:



Creating animated reels from provided scripts/voiceovers.

Designing minimalist vector assets and typography that align with a "dark mode" or high-contrast aesthetic.

Implementing smooth transitions and "snappy" animations that keep viewers engaged.

Adding sound design and subtle textures to give the animations a premium, "paper-like" or hand-drawn feel.



Requirements:



Proven Experience: You must have a portfolio or reel specifically showing the Dan Koe style 

Technical Skill: Proficiency in Adobe After Effects (required) and Illustrator. Experience with plug-ins like Motion 4 or similar workflow tools is a plus.

Aesthetic Eye: Understanding of negative space, pacing, and how to use "pop-on" text for maximum impact.

English Proficiency: High level of written English to ensure there are no typos in the animated text.



Reliability: Ability to meet deadlines and communicate clearly on progress.



Why Join Us?



Consistent, long-term work for the right candidate.

Competitive salary based on experience and output.

Creative freedom within the established brand aesthetic.



How to Apply:



Please include the following in your application:

Portfolio Link: Specifically highlight any "Dan Koe style" or minimalist animation work.

Tools: What software and hardware do you use?

Availability: How many hours per week can you dedicate to this role?



Note: Applications without a portfolio or specific examples of minimalist motion design will not be considered.
