title: Senior Virtual Assistant – Lead Response & Client Support (Full-Time)
description:
Company: The Grand UpperRoom

Location: Remote (Philippines-based)

Industry: Event Venue / Client Services



About Us

The Grand UpperRoom is a growing event venue business based in Texas, USA. We operate with established systems, scripts, and automation and are seeking an experienced Virtual Assistant who can execute consistently, follow workflows accurately, and ensure no lead or client inquiry is missed.

This role is not entry-level. We are looking for someone who can work independently within defined processes and does not require frequent reminders or supervision.



Role Overview

You will manage inbound client communication, review and follow up on leads, coordinate appointments and tours, and support the processing of booked clients through our internal systems. Success in this role depends on timeliness, organization, follow-through, and attention to detail, not creative writing.



Key Responsibilities

• Monitor and manage inbound communication across phone, SMS,
, and integrated inboxes, ensuring all inquiries are acknowledged promptly

• Review new and existing leads daily and take appropriate follow-up actions according to established workflows and priorities

• Schedule, confirm, and coordinate phone consultations and venue tours, including reminders, updates, and follow-ups

• Maintain accurate and organized records of all client interactions, outcomes, and next steps within the CRM

• Collect and verify essential client details (event type, date/date range, guest count, contact information) during initial interactions

• Process booked clients within internal systems, including preparing proposals, invoices, and related communications using approved templates and workflows

• Support client communication following proposals and invoices, including sending follow-up
s and texts using approved snippets and automations

• Respond to messages across multiple platforms (Google, social media, online directories, etc.) while balancing calls and scheduled tasks

• Identify and escalate sensitive or out-of-scope matters (refunds, cancellations, payment or contract concerns, complaints, unclear requests) to management using proper channels

• Conduct virtual venue tours when assigned (training and camera access provided) to support lead qualification and booking decisions

• Support general administrative tasks related to client communication, scheduling, and internal coordination as needed



Systems & Tools

• We use CRM and booking platforms such as GoHighLevel, Dubsado, Eventective, and Peerspace

• GoHighLevel is used primarily for customer communication and booking workflows

• Dubsado is used for proposals, contracts, invoicing, and client records

• Eventective and Peerspace are used mainly for lead capture and initial conversations

• Training will be provided; experience with similar CRM or client management platforms is highly transferable



Requirements

• Fluent in written and spoken English with a professional, client-friendly tone

• Comfortable communicating with North American clients via phone, text, and

• Spanish proficiency is a plus but not required

o Spanish-speaking inquiries may occasionally be supported using scripts, templates, or tools such as Google Translate

o Native or conversational Spanish fluency is not required

• Minimum 2 years of experience as a Virtual Assistant, Administrative VA, or Client Support VA

• Comfortable handling phone calls, follow-ups, appointment coordination, and client processing tasks

• Highly organized, detail-oriented, and reliable with deadlines and follow-through

• Proficient in working with multiple CRMs and able to quickly learn a new CRM

• Confident using Google Workspace (Gmail, Docs, Sheets, Calendar)

• Able to follow scripts, templates, and processes exactly as provided

• Stable internet connection and quiet work environment

This role is not suitable for candidates who:

• Need constant direction or reminders

• Prefer creative work over structured execution

• Avoid phone calls, documentation, or system-based tasks



Availability & Scheduling

• Coverage is required within a 14-hour window between 8:00 AM and 10:00 PM CST

• This role will follow an assigned shift within that window

• Includes scheduled rotational weekend coverage, with shifts assigned in advance

• Schedules are set ahead of time to ensure predictability and work-life balance



Work Schedule

• Full-time: 40 hours per week

• Fixed, assigned shift aligned with business needs

• Long-term position for the right candidate



Compensation

• $700 – $900 USD per month (?40,500 – ?52,000 PHP) full-time, based on experience and role alignment

• Paid bi-weekly on a regular schedule (final pay frequency discussed during hiring)

• Opportunities for performance-based bonuses tied to booking outcomes and overall contribution may be available after onboarding and probation



How to Apply

Please include:

1. Your resume

2. A short introduction summarizing your VA experience

3. Your years of experience and types of roles you’ve handled

4. Any CRM platforms or client management tools you’ve worked with

Important:

• When applying, please include “Process-Driven VA” in the subject line or first line of your application so we know you read the full job description.

• At the end of your application, briefly answer this question:

What is one thing you do to make sure no lead or client follow-up is missed?

Applications that do not follow these instructions may not be considered.

title: Amazon FBA Product Research VA (Online Arbitrage & Wholesale – Quality Focused) (BONUSES ON EVERY PURCAHSED PRODUCT))
description:
We are a UK-based Amazon FBA business looking for a reliable Product Research Virtual Assistant to help identify profitable products for Online Arbitrage and Wholesale sourcing.



This role focuses on QUALITY OVER QUANTITY. The objective is not to analyse the highest number of products, but to identify stable, profitable opportunities that meet clear and realistic buying criteria.



??????????????????



MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES



Scan supplier and wholesale product lists

Research products on Amazon UK

Analyse Keepa charts and price history

Calculate profit, ROI and competition levels

Identify stable and realistic buying opportunities

Record results accurately in Google Sheets



As the role develops, additional tasks may include researching potential suppliers and distributors and assisting with sourcing and supplier research.



This is a product research role only. No customer service, listing creation or advertising work is required.



??????????????????



REQUIREMENTS



Experience with Amazon FBA product research (Online Arbitrage or Wholesale)

Understanding of Keepa charts and Amazon fees

Strong attention to detail

Ability to prioritise accuracy over speed

Good English communication

Reliable internet connection



??????????????????



WORK STRUCTURE



Initial paid trial period (1 full day, 8 hours). In some cases a few trial days may be used to ensure a good long-term fit.

Trial rate: $2.00 per hour.

No bonus during the trial period.



After successful trial, the role moves to part-time and eventually full-time work.



We are looking for a long-term tea
mber. Pay for this role WILL increase over time as performance, reliability and results improve.



??????????????????



PAY STRUCTURE



Base pay is $2.00 per hour.



In addition, performance bonuses are paid for product leads that meet our buying criteria and are approved for purchase. The bonus structure rewards accuracy and quality rather than high volume.



Bonus structure example:



Approved product with approximately £100–£199 total expected profit ? $3 bonus

Approved product with approximately £200–£399 total expected profit ? $6 bonus

Approved product with approximately £400+ total expected profit ? $12 bonus



This structure encourages focusing on stronger opportunities rather than sending large numbers of low-quality leads.



This will include any wholesale excel sheets I provide (I will be sending quite a few of these to be scanned)



We prefer fewer high-quality leads instead of many low-quality submissions.



??????????????????



EXAMPLE BUYING CRITERIA (FOR GUIDANCE ONLY)



The following is an example of our current criteria. This is not final and we will discuss and agree on realistic criteria together once work begins.



Minimum ROI around 30%

Minimum profit around £3 per unit

Stable pricing history on Keepa

Reasonable competition levels

Products with strong overall profit potential



In general, if a product cannot comfortably generate approximately £100 total profit per purchase, it is usually not worth buying. Higher profit opportunities are more likely to be selected.



Final criteria will be discussed and refined together to ensure they are realistic and achievable.



??????????????????



WHEN APPLYING, PLEASE ANSWER THE FOLLOWING



How many years of experience do you have with Amazon FBA product research?

Which tools do you use for research (Keepa, SellerAmp, etc.)?

Find one real profitable product OA or Wholesale and explain in detail why it is a good pick (Doesn't have to be 100% ROI I am interested in your reasoning and explanation as to why it is good. Minimum 20% ROI)

On average, how many OA or Wholesale leads do you believe you can find in a full working day? (Please be honest — higher numbers do not mean better.)

What sourcing methods do you normally use (supplier lists, storefront research, reverse sourcing, manual sourcing, etc.)?

What criteria do you believe is most important when d
 if a product is a good buy?

Describe a situation where you d
 NOT to buy a product and why.



We value honest and realistic answers more than impressive numbers.



??????????????????



To confirm you have read the full job description, please include the word “Keepa” at the beginning of your application.

title: SEO Article Writer & Trend Researcher (3D Printing & Tech)
description:
We are a Canadian-based technology and e-commerce company operating multiple online brands in 3D printing, servers, and technical products. Our websites help customers research, compare, and buy specialized equipment and services.



We publish practical, search-driven content that answers real questions people are actively searching on Google, Reddit, and online communities.



We are looking for a writer who understands how people search online and can turn those searches into useful, high-quality articles and discussions.



Role Overview

Your primary role is to identify topics people are searching for and create helpful articles and supporting discussions around those topics.



You will research search trends using tools like AnswerThePublic, Google Trends, Reddit, and forums, then write SEO-focused content for our websites that answers those questions clearly and accurately.



You will also participate in relevant Reddit and forum discussions to help surface and reference our content in a natural way.



This is not spam or low-quality link building. The goal is authentic, helpful content and participation in real discussions.



Responsibilities

- Topic & Trend Research

- Find article ideas using AnswerThePublic, Google Trends, Reddit, forums, and search results

- Identify common questions, comparisons, and buying intent topics

- Propose content ideas based on real search demand

- SEO Article Writing

- Write clear, helpful articles based on researched topics

- Ensure articles match search intent and answer the user’s question

- Use AI tools to assist drafting when appropriate

- Edit and fact-check AI content for accuracy and readability

- Format content for WordPress or similar CMS



Community Participation

- Identify relevant Reddit threads and discussions

- Create genuine discussion posts when appropriate

- Participate in conversations naturally and helpfully

- Reference useful resources (including our content) where relevant

- Maintain multiple professional discussion accounts responsibly



Content Optimization

- Improve existing articles based on new trends

- Add FAQs and structured sections based on search data

- Help strengthen internal linking across our sites



Content Topics

You will write primarily about:

- 3D Printing

- 3D printers, filaments, materials, troubleshooting

- Comparisons, buying guides, how-to content

- Industry suppliers and services



Servers & Hosting

- Linux servers, Windows servers, VPS, dedicated hosting

- Performance, setup, comparisons, troubleshooting

- Infrastructure and technical guides



Other Technical Brands

- Manufacturing and technology products

- B2B suppliers and services

- Equipment and tools

 

Requirements

- Strong written English

- Experience writing SEO articles

- Ability to research topics independently

- Understanding of search intent and keyword targeting

- Comfortable using AI writing tools and editing outputs

- Familiar with Reddit and online forums

- Organized and detail-oriented



Nice to Have

- Experience in 3D printing or tech topics

- Basic understanding of SEO

- Experience with WordPress

- Experience researching buyer-intent keywords



How We Work

- We discuss brand guidelines and topic direction

- You propose article ideas based on search research

- Articles are reviewed and published by you

- Long-term role with consistent content needs

- Multiple brands and ongoing work available



To Apply

Please include:

- Links to SEO articles you wrote

- Your experience with research tools (AnswerThePublic, Trends, Reddit, etc.)

- Your process for finding article topics

- Your monthly rate or per-article rate or per hour

title: Video Ads Editor Long Form
description:
Video Editor (VSL & Direct-Response Ads) – Remote

Company Description



We are a fast-growing health-focused e-commerce brand operating primarily in the DACH market (Germany, Austria, Switzerland).

Our core product is a CE-certified medical back decompression device, sold via direct-response advertising (Meta,
, Instagram, YouTube).



We focus heavily on long-form VSLs, short-form ad creatives, and conversion-driven video content.



Role Description



This is a remote, contract-based position for a Video Editor with a strong focus on VSL editing and performance marketing creatives.



You will work closely with our marketing team and receive:



Fully written scripts



Clear creative direction



Examples of winning ads and VSLs



Your main responsibility is to turn scripts into emotionally engaging, high-converting video ads by:



Editing and structuring video content



Sourcing relevant stock footage or clips when needed



Creating AI-based content (UGC-style clips, avatars, or b-roll)



Syncing visuals tightly with script pacing and emotion



This role is execution-focused — strategy and scripts are provided.



Responsibilities



Edit 3–5 minute VSLs and shorter ad variations



Assemble videos using provided scripts and guidelines



Source or generate supporting visuals (stock, b-roll, AI tools)



Create direct-response style edits (hooks, pacing, clarity, emotion)



Occasionally create AI UGC-style content or short clips



Deliver clean, structured files ready for paid advertising



Required Qualifications



At least 1 year of video editing experience, preferably for social media or ads



Solid understanding of direct-response video structure



Strong English communication skills (at least B2/C1)



Proficiency with common editing tools (Premiere Pro, After Effects, CapCut, etc.)



Ability to follow instructions precisely and meet deadlines



Willingness to iterate and improve based on feedback



Nice to Have (Big Plus)



Experience editing VSLs or long-form ad content



Familiarity with AI tools such as:



Veo 3



Sora 2



AI UGC/avatar generators



Basic understanding of performance marketing (hooks, retention, CTA timing)



Work Structure



Remote



Initial commitment: ~16 hours per week



Possibility to scale to full-time within 6–8 weeks



Flexible schedule, but fast turnaround and responsiveness are important



Personal Qualities We Value



Strong attention to detail



Ability to follow systems and instructions



Willingness to learn and adapt quickly



Reliability and clear communication



Long-term mindset (we prefer ongoing collaborations)



How to Apply (Important)



Please apply via the Google Form below (preferred).

We use this to ensure applicants can follow instructions.



Google Form Link:

title: Growth & Revenue Operator
description:
We are hiring a Growth & Revenue Operator to partner directly with the CEO in scaling a women’s health DTC CGP brand currently generating approximately $55K per month in revenue.



This is not a VA role.

This is a strategic execution role.



You will help bring structured growth thinking, disciplined execution, and revenue accountability to the business.



You are not expected to replace the CEO’s vision.

You are expected to help turn it into measurable results.



What You Will Own

• Build and maintain weekly revenue dashboards

• Track CAC, AOV, LTV, retention, and subscription metrics

• Identify bottlenecks and propose focused growth initiatives

• Structure and manage 90-day growth sprints

• Coordinate creative testing with paid media and content

• Optimize subscription and affiliate performance

• Build and document SOPs for all growth workflows



What We’re Looking For

• Strong understanding of DTC growth fundamentals

• Comfortable with Shopify analytics and subscription metrics

• Thinks in tradeoffs and prioritization

• Able to make data-backed recommendations

• Works US hours

• Proactive, organized, and disciplined

• Comfortable pushing back respectfully with logic



Experience with Klaviyo, subscription apps, funnel math, and project management tools is preferred.





What Success Looks Like in the First 90 Days

• A clear revenue dashboard built from scratch

• Weekly KPI reporting rhythm established

• A defined growth sprint in motion

• At least three structured experiments running

• All major growth processes documented





Application Process

Step 1: Video Submission

Record a 2 to 3 minute video answering:

“How would you approach scaling a $55K per month DTC brand to $100K per month within 3 months?”



Focus on prioritization, not volume of ideas.



Step 2: Sample Work

Submit one example of a dashboard or reporting framework you have built.



Step 3: 100-Day Growth Plan Exercise



Selected candidates will be asked to sign an NDA and receive limited brand data including:

• Current revenue

• AOV

•
 list size

• Subscription percentage

• Traffic sources

• Product mix



Based on this information, you will outline a focused 100-day growth plan including:

 1. Top 3 revenue priorities only

 2. Specific initiatives within each priority

 3. Weekly KPIs that would be tracked

 4. What you would stop or deprioritize

 5. Key risks and tradeoffs



This exercise is designed to evaluate strategic thinking, clarity, and prioritization.



We are not looking for 30 ideas.

We are looking for focus and revenue logic.

title: Video Editor – Short Form & Paid Creative
description:
We are hiring a skilled Video Editor to help drive content and paid creative for a fast-growing women’s health DTC brand.



This is not just an editing role.



This role exists to turn raw footage into scroll-stopping, conversion-focused content that supports growth across organic and paid channels.



You will work closely with the CEO and Growth Operator.





What You Will Create

• High-performing Reels and TikTok videos

• Paid ad creatives for Meta and TikTok

• YouTube Shorts

• Founder-led talking head edits

• Test variations of the same creative

• Long-form repurposing into short-form assets



You will help build a creative engine, not just edit clips.



What We Expect From You

• Strong understanding of short-form hook structure

• Ability to edit for retention and pacing

• Strong instincts around scroll behavior

• Understanding of direct-response creative principles

• Ability to test multiple angles from one raw video

• Organized file management and content library systems

• Comfortable working with performance feedback



You should be able to explain why an edit performs, not just how it looks.



You Will Also

• Build repeatable editing workflows

• Create branded templates

• Organize content by theme, offer, and campaign

• Document editing SOPs

• Collaborate with paid media to produce testing variations

• Help scale creative output without sacrificing quality





What Success Looks Like in 60–90 Days

• Consistent output of 3–5 short-form pieces per week

• Creative variations built intentionally for testing

• Improved retention metrics on short-form content

• Paid creative structured for performance, not aesthetics

• Organized creative library with clear labeling





Application Process



Step 1: Portfolio Submission

Submit at least 3 short-form examples. Include one that feels direct-response oriented.



Step 2: Why This Role Video

Record a 2–3 minute video explaining:

	1.	What makes short-form content convert?

	2.	How you think about retention and pacing

	3.	How you would approach editing for a founder-led brand





Step 3: Editing Test

We will provide raw footage.

You will:



• Create 1 organic version

• Create 1 paid-ad version

• Provide 2 alternate hooks



We are evaluating creative thinking, not just technical skill.

title: Fractional Paid Media Partner – DTC Growth
description:
We are seeking a fractional paid media partner to help scale a women’s health DTC brand currently generating approximately $55K per month in revenue.



This is not a campaign management role.



We are looking for a performance-driven partner who understands how to scale subscription-based DTC brands from $50K per month toward $200K+ per month with disciplined testing, creative leadership, and clear performance accountability.



You will work directly with the CEO and Growth Operator.



What This Role Is Responsible For

• Owning paid acquisition strategy across Meta, TikTok, google and other relevant channels

• Developing and managing a structured creative testing roadmap

• Providing weekly performance breakdowns with actionable insights

• Recommending budget allocation based on performance and blended CAC

• Setting CAC targets aligned with LTV and subscription economics

• Coordinating with internal creative and growth teams

• Documenting paid media SOPs for long-term scalability



This role is not about launching ads and reporting ROAS.

It is about building a repeatable acquisition engine.



What We Are Looking For

• Proven experience scaling DTC brands in the $50K to $200K+ per month range

• Strong understanding of subscription LTV and payback periods

• Creative-first mindset

• Experience running structured testing cycles

• Ability to communicate clearly in weekly reporting

• Comfort operating with data and making decisive recommendations



You must be able to explain not only what happened, but why it happened and what to do next.



What Success Looks Like in 90 Days

• Clear paid acquisition strategy aligned with revenue targets

• Creative testing framework in place

• Consistent weekly reporting cadence

• Defined CAC targets tied to LTV

• Predictable acquisition performance trends



Application Process



Step 1: Why This Role Video

Submit a 3 to 5 minute video answering:

 1. Why are you uniquely qualified to scale a subscription-based DTC brand at this stage?

 2. What mistakes do brands at $50K per month typically make in paid acquisition?

 3. What would you prioritize first in the first 60 days?



Step 2: Case Exercise

You will be provided with high-level metrics under NDA including:

• Current revenue

• AOV

• Subscription percentage

• Current ad spend

• Current blended CAC

• Top-performing products



Based on this information, provide:

• A 60-day paid acquisition roadmap

• CAC targets tied to LTV assumptions

• Budget allocation recommendation

• Creative testing plan

• Risks and tradeoffs



We are evaluating clarity, logic, and prioritization — not presentation design.

title: Senior U.S. Bankruptcy Paralegal (Remote)
description:
We are seeking an experienced Senior Bankruptcy Paralegal to join our growing team. This is a full-time remote position with long-term opportunity.



We handle Chapters 7, 13, and 11 cases and are looking for someone with real debtor-side experience who can independently prepare, review, and manage bankruptcy files from intake through confirmation or discharge.



This is not an entry-level role. Hands-on U.S. bankruptcy drafting experience is required.



About the Role



You will take ownership of assigned cases and ensure petitions, schedules, statements, and plans are accurate and complete before filing. You will work closely with attorneys and internal staff to keep cases moving efficiently.



Responsibilities



• Prepare and draft Chapter 7 and Chapter 13 petitions and schedules

• Assist with Chapter 11 filings when applicable

• Prepare Chapter 13 plans and amendments

• Review client financial documents for accuracy and consistency

• Calculate income, expenses, and disposable income

• Prepare amendments in response to trustee objections

• Monitor deadlines and case progress

• Maintain organized electronic case files



Who We’re Looking For



• 3+ years of U.S. debtor-side bankruptcy experience

• Strong experience with Chapters 7 and 13 (Chapter 11 a plus)

• Comfortable drafting schedules and statements independently

• Experience handling trustee objections and amendments

• Detail-oriented and highly organized

• Able to manage volume while maintaining accuracy

• Strong written communication skills



We are a structured, high-volume firm. We value precision, ownership, and reliability.



To Apply



Please include:



1. A summary of your U.S. bankruptcy experience

2. Which chapters you have worked on

3. The types of documents you have personally drafted

4. Your expected monthly compensation

5. Your availability



In your subject line, please write: SENIOR PARALEGAL



We are looking for professionals who take pride in accuracy and getting cases to the finish line.

title: Real Estate Investment Underwriter
description:
The Real Estate Investment Underwriter is a core decision-maker responsible for evaluating residential properties across multiple exit strategies to determine whether a deal meets the company’s investment criteria. This role directly impacts company profitability by validating assumptions, stress-testing scenarios, and ensuring every approved deal has a clear, executable path to profit.  The Underwriter is the gatekeeper of company profitability. Every deal we do, or avoid, starts with this role. Strong underwriting protects the company from bad investments and ensures capital is deployed only where risk is understood and returns are justified.



The Underwriter analyzes properties under three primary scenarios:



1) Off-Market / Investor Sale (Cash)

2) On-Market / As-Is Condition

3) On-Market / Renovate & Resell at After Repair Value (ARV)



This role is not theoretical — your numbers drive real capital deployment and are utilized for critical decisions.



The ideal DISC style is a High C / Mid D / Moderate S / Moderate I - someone who is obsessed with accuracy and data integrity, naturally skeptical of assumptions, strong at risk identification, comfortable slowing things down to get the numbers right, process oriented and analytical, loves numbers, and questions everything.  This person should be able to work independently and take ownership of outcomes while being able to defend their analysis/numbers if a deal does not work.  



Key Responsibilities



Investment Analysis & Deal Underwriting

- Analyze residential properties to determine as-is value, investor value (off market), and After Repair Value (ARV)

- Run detailed financial models for multiple exit strategies

- Validate deal viability using company investment criteria (returns, risk, timelines)

- Stress-test assumptions (pricing, repairs, hold time, market shifts)

- Clearly determine DEAL / NO DEAL decisions on opportunities



Valuation & Market Analysis

- Pull, analyze, and interpret comparable sales (on-market and off-market)

- Adjust comps accurately for condition, location, timing, and renovations

- Track market trends and pricing shifts to ensure current, defensible valuations

- Evaluate neighborhood-level risk and liquidity



Rehab & Cost Analysis

- Verify repair assumptions align with resale strategy and buyer expectations

- Apply appropriate contingency and cost buffers to protect margins



Profitability & Risk Management

- Ensure every approved deal meets required profit margins and return thresholds

- Account for all costs: acquisition, rehab, holding, financing, selling, and overhead

- Identify deal-breakers early to protect time, capital, and resources

- Flag high-risk variables before commitment



Communication & Decision Support

- Present underwriting conclusions clearly to acquisitions, leadership, and partners

- Defend valuations and assumptions with data and logic

- Provide quick, confident feedback to support fast decision-making

- Maintain underwriting documentation for accountability and post-deal review



Required Skills & Experience

- 2–5+ years in real estate underwriting, investing, acquisitions, or valuation

- Strong understanding of:

     - After Repair Value (ARV) methodology

     - Investor pricing models (70% rule, margin-based underwriting, etc.)

     - Rehab cost estimation

     - Holding costs and deal timelines

- Advanced proficiency in Excel / Google Sheets (financial modeling required)

- Deep familiarity with MLS data, comps, and market analysis

- Ability to thoroughly underwrite deals with detailed accuracy

- High attention to detail with strong judgment under pressure



Ideal Candidate Traits

- Profit-driven thinker – understands that numbers = real dollars at risk

- Decisive but disciplined – confident making DEAL / NO DEAL decisions

- Skeptical by nature – pressure-tests assumptions instead of accepting them

- Process-oriented – consistent underwriting methodology

- Ownership mindset – treats company capital like their own



Compensation

Pay rate: $8-$10 per hour, based on experience, plus bonus 

Schedule: 40 hours per week (It could be more based on workload)

Training: Yes, training will be provided.

title: Full-Time GoHighLevel (GHL) Level 1 & 2 Support Agent - Client-Facing Technical Support
description:
We are seeking an experienced, full-time GoHighLevel (GHL) support specialist who excels at day-to-day client assistance — NOT complex workflow building or automation development.



You will be judged more on simple, practical support tasks — like helping a client trace what workflow a message came from in the Conversations tab — than on building advanced automations.



We already have builders. We need someone who lives in support tickets and understands how real clients use (and sometimes misuse) the platform every day.



You will receive training on our specific processes, tools, and clients, but not on the fundamentals of the GHL platform itself. You must already have strong, practical knowledge from real client-facing support experience on GHL.





Key Responsibilities:



- Provide Tier 1 & 2 support: troubleshooting workflows, triggers, tags, conversations, calendars, campaign optimization, and common user questions.

- Onboard new clients to GHL (account setup, snapshots, basic workflows).

- Guide non-technical clients through practical platform usage with patience and clear communication.



Required Experience & Skills:



- Proven client-facing GHL support experience (onboarding AND ongoing daily support tickets) — not just personal or agency building.

- Deep knowledge of everyday user issues: tracing messages to workflows, fixing conversation routing, tag failures, calendar sync problems, etc.

- Excellent English communication (written & spoken).

- Full-time availability with overlap in US time zones (Arizona/Phoenix preferred).



This is a 100% remote, full-time position (30+ hours/week).

Paid via PayPal/Payoneer or similar.



How to Apply:

To be considered, please apply with:



- Submit a short video introduction (1-2 minutes max, recorded via 
 or similar free tool — unlisted YouTube link also fine). 

- In your written application please include how many months/years you have in client-facing GHL support (exclude personal or internal agency building only).

- Approximate number of clients you have onboarded AND provided ongoing support to.

- 2–3 specific examples of practical support issues you've resolved (e.g., "Helped client trace an inbound message to the correct workflow using the Conversations tab" or similar real ticket examples).

- Your current time zone and daily availability for US overlap.

- Attach resume/portfolio if available.



Serious applicants with real GHL support experience only. Generic applications or those without the required examples will not be considered.



We will review applications and reach out via the platform for interviews.



Thank you!

title: Travel Blog Post Writer
description:
JOB OVERVIEW



We are looking for a creative, detail-oriented Content Writer & Virtual Assistant to help grow Berlin Bound, a travel website dedicated to exploring the best of Berlin, Germany. 



You will be responsible for researching local gems, writing engaging blog posts, and assisting with SEO-focused content updates.



This is a part-time remote position. 



We are looking for someone who doesn’t just "write for AI" or "for algorithms." Instead, we want someone who can craft stories that make readers feel like they are walking through the streets of Kreuzberg or Mitte.





KEY RESPONSIBILITIES



Content Writing: Draft 2–5 high-quality blog posts per week (varying between 500 and 2,000 words, depending on the post) ranging from "Best Vegan Brunch in Berlin" to "A Guide to the Berlin Wall Memorial."



Deep Research: Use Google Maps, local blogs, and German tourism sites (translated) to find up-to-date prices, opening hours, and "hidden" spots.



SEO Optimization: Use tools like RankMath to ensure articles rank for target keywords. But we won't be over-optimizing. Instead, we're focusing on creating quality content for human readers.



Formatting: Upload and format posts in WordPress (adding headers, alt-text for images, and internal links).



Content Repurposing: Occasionally turn blog posts into short social media captions or newsletter snippets.





SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS



Exceptional English: Must have near-native written English with a conversational, engaging tone.



Research Pro: Ability to find specific details (e.g., "Which U-Bahn station is closest to this gallery?") quickly and accurately.



WordPress Experience: Comfortable working with WordPress. Bonus points if you're comfortable with Kadence!



SEO Knowledge: Familiarity with H1/H2 structures, keyword density, and meta descriptions.



Self-Starter: You can take a topic like "3 Days in Berlin" and run with it without constant hand-holding.



Interest in Travel: (Bonus) If you’ve traveled or have a passion for European history/culture, that’s a huge plus!





PAY & BENEFITS



Pay: $7 USD hourly



Schedule: Flexible schedule with minimal meetings. Most communication will be done via
 & Slack. At first, you can expect to work between 3 and 5 hours per week. More hours will become available over time.



Thirteenth Month Pay: Included!



Birthday Bonus: Get a bonus equal to 8 hours of work, times your hourly rate, for your birthday. Must be on the team for at least 90 days to qualify.



Health Insurance Reimbursement: $50 USD per month to contribute towards a monthly healthcare plan from companies like Maxicare or PhilHealth. Must be on the team for at least 90 days to qualify.



Launch Revenue Share Bonuses: Each tea
mber receives a bonus equal in proportion to how our launches go. We believe it's important to share the successes with our virtual assistants!



Holidays Off: Our offices are closed during major holidays in the United States and in the Phillipines. Please note that these are not paid days, but that we won't ask you to work on them. If you'd like to have more hours and work on these days, please let us know during the interview process. You can learn more here: 





HOW TO APPLY



To ensure you have high attention to detail, please follow these steps:



• Change the subject line to: "Berlin is Calling – [Your Name]"



• Tell me about one place in Berlin you think sounds interesting and why (a 2-sentence Google search is fine!). Please don't use A.I. for this part; I want to see how you actually write.



• Attach your portfolio or links to 2–3 travel-related articles you have written.



• If you have your own travel blog, or if you've worked with a travel website before, share that as well.



• Tell me your favorite SEO tool and why you like it.

title: Motion Designer / Animator - Meta ADS
description:
We’re looking for a high-performing motion designer / animator to join our creative team full-time. Your mission: take our best-performing static ads and bring them to life through short, scroll-stopping animations (5–10 seconds).



You’ll work closely with our creative leads but are expected to ideate, execute, and deliver finished assets daily with minimal direction. You should thrive in a fast-paced, performance-driven environment where every piece of creative is designed to convert.



What You’ll Do

 • Animate static ads into short, dynamic motion pieces (5–10 sec) optimized for Meta.

 • Concept and design original ad ideas from scratch when needed, not just animate existing assets.

 • Collaborate with our creative strategists to test variations and iterate quickly based on performance.

 • Maintain brand consistency across all animations and formats.

 • Turn around polished deliverables daily (we move fast).

 • Stay on top of creative trends, motion design techniques, and what’s working in the CPG and DTC space.



You’re a Great Fit If You:

 • Have 2–4+ years of experience animating for CPG / DTC brands (ads, launches, etc.).

 • Are fluent in After Effects, Premiere, or equivalent motion tools.

 • Can look at a static ad and instantly see how to make it move, pop, and convert.

 • Understand paid social performance creative (what hooks, what loops, what stops the scroll).

 • Are self-driven, disciplined, and can deliver without hand-holding.

 • Have a strong eye for typography, pacing, and visual rhythm.



Requirements

 • Strong portfolio or reel showing animations you’ve done for CPG or DTC brands.

 • Must understand the difference between beautiful motion and performance motion.

 • Reliable internet connection.

 • Speak perfect English.

 • Full-time availability (40 hrs/week).

title: Credit Repair Dispute Specialist
description:
Swipes Enterprises



A little bit about us,



We have been in the industry for more than 2 years now and have seen a lot of changes going on with the disputing strategies and methods to fix our clients credit score the best way and as safety as possible. And I mean ALL of it. For someone coming to work with Swipes Enterprises they are entering an already existing framework that they can get started with. No need to help business owners or staff to get them up to speed. Continuing on 2026 we are looking to strength our dispute process and coach some A++ players on our team to create an amazing environment that will change lives this year. We are highly motivated to give our clients the #1 investment for this year, which is a health credit score. So if you see yourself as someone who can take on a leadership role and work well with others, this will be a great opportunity for you. 



(1 Stop available only)



Position Overview

We are seeking a highly detail-oriented and compliance-driven Credit Repair Dispute Specialist to manage client credit file audits, dispute processing, and regulatory-compliant communications.



This role requires advanced knowledge of consumer credit laws, regulatory bodies, and structured dispute strategy. The ideal candidate is organized, fast, accurate, and capable of handling sensitive financial information with absolute precision.



This is not entry-level. We are looking for professionals who understand the seriousness of consumer credit compliance and documentation accuracy.



Core Responsibilities



Able to read full credit reports from (Experian, Equifax, TransUnion)



Identify reporting inaccuracies



Draft and process dispute letters aligned with FCRA standards



Track dispute timelines and bureau responses (A BIG ONE HERE AT SWIPES)



Maintain organized client files



Ensure 100?curacy of personal identifiers and sensitive information



Monitor escalations and regulatory complaint workflows



Manage multiple client cases simultaneously without errors



Regulatory & Industry Knowledge Required



Candidates must demonstrate some knowledge of:



Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA)



Fair Debt Collection Practices Act (FDCPA)



Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB)



Federal Trade Commission (FTC)



Better Business Bureau (BBB)



State Attorney General complaint processes



Credit bureau reinvestigation procedures



Compliance-based dispute strategies (not template)



MORE SO GOOD TACTICAL SKILLS 



Required Skills & Traits



Extremely detail-oriented (double-checks all work before submission)

-Organized with structured workflow systems

-Ability to multitask across multiple active files

-Fast turnaround time without sacrificing accuracy

-Strong written communication skills



High level of discretion with sensitive client information



Comfortable working within SOPs and compliance guidelines



Self-managed and deadline-driven



Performance Expectations



Zero tolerance for data errors



Timely dispute cycle management



Proper documentation of every action taken



Clean, audit-ready file organization



Professional communication internally and externally



Ideal Candidate Profile



Prior experience in credit repair or financial services



Strong understanding of bureau dispute cycles



Experience handling CFPB or regulatory complaints



Familiar with CRM systems and digital file organization



Operates with precision under pressure. Looking forward to speaking with you.

title: E-commerce Copywriter (Direct Response | Native Ads, VSLs, Landing Pages, Advertorials)
description:
About the Company

Allipse Marketing Management owns and operates multiple direct-to-consumer brands in the US market, specializing in health, beauty, and wellness. We sell products that solve real problems for real customers.

Now we're looking for a Copywriter to craft the words that sell — writing persuasive scripts, ads, and landing pages that connect with our audience and drive conversions.



About the Role

We're looking for a Copywriter who knows how to turn ideas into words that move people. You'll write the copy behind our
 ads, Native ads, VSL scripts, landing pages, and static creatives — crafting messages that grab attention, build desire, and drive action.

If you're equal parts storyteller and strategist, and you love figuring out what makes customers tick, this one's for you.



What You'll Own

Conduct deep market research — understanding customer avatars, core desires, pain points, and the exact language customers use

Write
 ad copy (primary text, headlines, hooks) that stops the scroll and drives clicks

Write VSL scripts that hold attention and convert viewers into buyers

Create punchy headlines for static image ads

Write landing page copy — from headlines to CTAs to full sales pages

Apply awareness stages and market sophistication principles to craft the right message for the right audience

Collaborate with video editors, designers, and media buyers to bring your copy to life

Review performance and tweak your copy to make every word work harder



Who You Are

Experienced copywriter with understanding of direct response principles

Familiar with concepts like awareness stages, market sophistication, and customer avatars

Strong command of English with a natural sense of tone and flow

Passionate about audience psychology and what drives people to act

Curious, analytical, and open to testing, learning, and iterating

Comfortable using AI tools to work smarter and faster



You'll Thrive Here If…

You're driven by results and love seeing your words make an impact

You geek out on customer psychology, research, and optimization

You value persuasion and performance over clever-sounding copy

You can write for US audiences across health, beauty, and wellness



Growth Path

Copywriter ? Senior Copywriter ? Lead Copywriter ? Creative Strategist



To Apply



Please send:



Your resume / CV



A portfolio of copywriting work 
 ads, Native ads hooks, VSL scripts, landing pages, or
 copy)



(If available) examples of ads or pages that actually performed, with brief context

title: Affiliate Systems & Social Media Specialist (Full Time, Long Term)
description:
We are a family-run wellness brand. We don’t just want someone to "post content"—we want a systems-minded Specialist who loves the logic of affiliate marketing and the beauty of a well-curated social feed.



This is a role for someone who is naturally warm, kind, and loves people, but is also a "power user" when it comes to organization. We lead with love and treat our team like family, and in return, we look for absolute reliability and a desire to master your craft.



Why This Role is Different

Direct Impact: You aren't just a cog in a machine. You will own the affiliate systems and have the freedom to improve our processes.

AI Training: We will actively train you on the latest AI tools to ensure you stay at the forefront of the industry.

Stability & Heart: We offer a "forever home." No agency chaos—just a supportive, pleasant environment where your peace of mind matters.



Your Expertise

Affiliate Operations: You understand the "why" behind the links. You’ll manage onboarding, distribute assets, and ensure our partners feel valued and supported.

The Tech: You should be comfortable with ClickUp (not just for tasks, but for project tracking) and ManyChat (for building engaging automation flows).

Visual Curation: You have a sharp eye for aesthetics. You will manage our content calendar, ensuring Reels covers, carousels, and static posts are visually cohesive and on-brand.

Growth Mindset: You don't just follow a manual; you look for ways to make the system faster, smarter, and better.



Who You Are

A "People Person": You radiate warmth and enjoy professional, pleasant interactions with partners and tea
mbers.

System, Organize: You get excited by a clean ClickUp board and a perfectly organized content library.

Exclusive & Committed: You are looking for one full-time home (no side-gigs) where you can dedicate your best work.



Compensation & Premium Benefits

+ Competitive Salary (Paid in PHP): We pay for quality and reliability.

+ Annual Growth: Yearly raises based on performance and system improvements.

+ 13th Month Pay Guaranteed.

+ Paid Vacation, sick leave, and all National Holidays off.

+ Ongoing Education: We pay for your training in AI and advanced digital marketing tools.



How to Apply:

We only hire people who pay attention to the details. To apply,
 
 with:



Subject Line: [Your Name] | Affiliate & Systems Specialist



Paragraph 1: What is your favorite breakfast food?

Paragraph 2: Briefly explain any ClickUp board or ManyChat flow you have personally built.

Paragraph 3: Why are you looking for a long-term "family" environment rather than project-based freelance work?



Attachment: Your CV and a link to a portfolio or samples of content calendars/social media grids you have curated.

title: Google Merchant Center Cleanup, PMax & Shopping Campaign Setup for Supplement Brand
description:
We are a health supplement company selling two SKUs and need a Google Ads specialist to clean up our Google Merchant Center account, ensure full compliance, and set up campaigns for the US and Canadian markets. This is a one-time setup project, not ongoing management.



Google Merchant Center Cleanup & Compliance:

Audit the existing Merchant Center account and resolve all current errors and disapproved products. Remove duplicate product listings (we only have 2 SKUs — there should be no duplicates). Ensure both product listings are accurate with correct titles, descriptions, images, pricing, and availability. Verify product data feed is properly structured and compliant with Google's policies for health supplement advertising. Set up proper targeting for United States and Canada only. Ensure the account is fully compliant with Google's policies so we can advertise without issues or suspensions.



Campaign Setup:

Set up one Performance Max (PMax) campaign targeting US and CA with proper asset groups, audience signals, and product feed integration. Set up one standard Shopping campaign as a secondary campaign. Configure proper bidding strategy, budget allocation, and geo-targeting for both campaigns. Ensure campaigns are ready to launch and structured for a supplement product in the health/wellness category.



Requirements:

Proven experience with Google Merchant Center account management and troubleshooting. Experience setting up PMax and Shopping campaigns for eCommerce / DTC brands. Familiarity with Google's advertising policies for health supplements (understanding of what claims are and aren't allowed). Experience with Google tag implementation and conversion tracking setup. Ability to complete the full scope within 3–5 business days.

To Apply

Please include a brief summary of your experience with Google Merchant Center and PMax campaigns, specifically any work you've done with health or supplement brands. Mention any relevant examples of resolving Merchant Center compliance issues or disapproved products.



Project Type: One-time setup (no ongoing management)

Timeline: 3–5 business days

Target Markets: United States & Canada

title: WordPress Content VA + On-Page SEO (Stencil Site) + Pinterest
description:
I own 
, a free printable stencil website. I am hiring a long-term virtual assistant to publish new stencil content every week, improve SEO (especially thin-content issues), and help grow traffic and revenue. We provide a custom AI tool that can generate stencil images, so you will be using our tool as part of the workflow. The weekly output target is 3 new uploads per week, and each upload should contain 3 to 8 stencil images (a stencil set). The stencil sets must match current trends such as upcoming holidays, seasonal topics, and what people are searching for (Google search trends). You will publish each stencil set in WordPress by uploading the images, ensuring proper file naming and alt text, placing the content in the correct categories/tags, and adding internal links to relevant pages on the site.



Pinterest is also required: you will upload the images to our Pinterest account by creating Pins for each new stencil set (and sometimes individual stencils if appropriate), writing keyword-focused Pin titles and descriptions, linking back to the correct page on our website, and saving Pins to the right boards consistently.



A major focus for this role is improving thin pages. Many pages in this niche can become “thin” if they only contain an image and little text. You must learn how to improve page quality by adding helpful text, usage ideas, simple instructions, FAQs, better formatting, and stronger internal linking so each page provides real value beyond the download. We are looking for Google SEO knowledge and experience to help improve the site performance. Experience with WordPress posting, on-page SEO, image optimization/compression, and Pinterest posting is important. Familiarity with SEO plugins and Google Search Console is a plus.



Bonuses: Bonuses will be provided for improvements in website revenue.



To Apply: Please send your WordPress and SEO experience, any Pinterest work examples, and a short explanation of how you would improve a thin-content stencil page that is mostly images.

title: SEO Content Writer / Research VA
description:
I own 
, a content website focused on battery replacement equivalents and cross-reference information running on Joomla. I am hiring a virtual assistant who can research accurately, write clearly, and publish SEO-optimized content consistently. The weekly output target is 3 to 5 posts per week. Posts will include battery equivalent/replacement pages, comparisons (example: X vs Y), guides, and FAQ-style content. Accuracy matters because battery codes and equivalencies can be easy to confuse, so strong research habits and attention to detail are required. You will write and format content in a user-friendly way, including clean headings, summaries, tables when helpful, and FAQ sections when appropriate. You will also do on-page SEO on every post by choosing correct keywords based on search intent, writing strong titles and headings, creating meta titles/descriptions when needed, and adding internal links to relevant pages on the site. You will also refresh and improve older posts to boost rankings, clarity, and usefulness.



This role requires awareness that Google SEO changes and that some tactics stop working. Experience with SEO content writing, keyword research, and formatting tables/spreadsheets is strongly preferred. Joomla experience is a plus.



Bonuses: Bonuses will be provided for improvements in website revenue.



To Apply: Please send 2 writing samples (preferably informational/technical), describe your process for researching and confirming accuracy, and list any SEO tools you have used.

title: Exceptional Virtual Assistant
description:
Hello! 



Exchange Families International (EFI) is a student exchange company focused on real connection, language immersion, and meaningful host family matches. I’m hiring one exceptional Virtual Assistant to work closely with me long-term. This is for someone who takes pride in doing things properly—organized, reliable, and confident in written English.

If you’re looking for a role where you can grow, be trusted, and become a key part of a mission-driven team, keep reading.



What you’ll do

You’ll support me with a mix of writing, organization, and creative tasks. The workload will evolve, but typical responsibilities include:

- Writing + editing: drafting
s, polishing wording, proofreading, tightening tone, rewriting content so it sounds clear and human

- Admin + organization: managing task lists, tracking deadlines, organizing files, creating checklists, keeping projects moving

- Communication support: follow-ups, internal notes, organizing info so nothing gets missed

- Graphic design (light): clean Canva designs for simple social graphics, flyers, PDFs, and basic layouts

- Research + support tasks: gathering info, summarizing findings, scheduling, and miscellaneous CEO support



You’re a strong fit if you are…

- A master of written English (grammar, tone, clarity, strong sentence structure)

- Highly organized and able to manage multiple priorities without dropping details

- Proactive: you don’t wait to be told every step—you think ahead and suggest improvements

- Comfortable with Google Drive/Docs/Sheets and learning new systems

- Confident in Canva (or similar) and have a clean design eye

- Reliable, responsive, and consistent



Bonus (not required):

- Experience supporting a CEO/founder

- Basic video editing for short-form content (Reels/TikTok style)

- Experience in education, travel, or customer-facing roles



Work setup (read carefully)

- Full-time role (40 hours/week)

- Night shift (Philippines time) to align with my workday in British Columbia, Canada

- Long-term position for the right person

- Remote role working directly with me

- You’ll need reliable internet, a dependable computer, and consistent availability during scheduled hours



How to apply (important — read carefully)

We receive many copy/paste applications, so we use a quick filter to find applicants who are genuinely interested. If you miss any step below, your application won’t be reviewed!



Please send ONE message that includes

1. A short written intro (3–6 sentences) about you and why this role fits you.

2. A personal video (60–90 seconds) (Loom, unlisted YouTube, or Google Drive link). In your video:

    - Tell me why you want to work with Exchange Families International (make it personal so I get to know you!)

    - Use the word “adventure” naturally in a sentence

    - Describe your favorite sandwich and why it’s so good? (Yes, really — I’m checking communication skills, personality, and attention to detail.)

3. Your resume.

4. Answer these questions:

    - What tools do you use to stay organized?

    - What is your weekly availability (days + hours)?

    - What is your expected hourly rate?

    - What are your top 2 strengths as a VA?



Final note

This is not a background role where tasks get done halfway. I’m hiring a real teammate—someone who cares about quality, wants to be proud of their work, and enjoys being part of a company that helps families and students change their lives. Please apply only if you can commit to full-time night shift hours consistently!

If that sounds like you, send your application (and don’t forget the video!).

title: Social Media Growth VA for Collage/Scrapbooking Artist (Instagram + TikTok + Pinterest)
description:
I am hiring a virtual assistant to drive traffic and growth for my wife’s collage/scrapbooking art accounts on Instagram and TikTok, with Pinterest distribution included. Her art style is analog collage made from magazine clippings and paper layering, often filmed as process content. Your main goal is to increase profile visits, followers, and inquiries by running a consistent discovery and distribution system.



Your weekly responsibilities include doing 30–60 minutes per day of targeted engagement and leaving 10–20 meaningful comments per day on niche-relevant accounts (collage, junk journaling, scrapbooking, mixed media, paper craft, vintage ephemera). You will also send 20–40 outreach messages per week to feature pages and collaboration partners, tracking all outreach in a spreadsheet and following up professionally. For Pinterest, you will create 3–5 new pins per finished artwork, aiming for 15–30 pins per week, using strong keyword titles/descriptions and posting to well-organized boards.



You will also deliver a weekly report summarizing what drove profile visits, what hooks and formats worked best, and which posts should be remade or repurposed. You must understand that social algorithms and SEO change; we want someone who tests, learns, and adapts based on data, not outdated tactics. Bonuses will be provided for measurable improvements in traffic, follower growth, and revenue (commissions/print sales). To apply, send examples of accounts you have helped grow and describe how you would promote a collage artist specifically.

title: AI Lifestyle Content Creator & Brand Asset Builder for E-commerce Brands
description:
AI Lifestyle Content Creator & Brand Asset Builder for E-commerce Brands



The Mission

We are building a scalable, premium lifestyle content engine for our fast-growing e-commerce brands — primarily 
 (travel & remote work gear) and secondarily 
  (wellness tools).



Your core mission:

Build a premium brand-aligned lifestyle content system that allows us to redesign our webshops, marketplace listings, and social channels with 10/10 quality assets.



This is not about creating “AI art.”



This is about building a structured, reusable lifestyle asset library that strengthens brand identity and drives commercial impact.





3-Month Outcome

Within the first 3 months, you will help us build:



- 100+ reusable, high-end lifestyle assets

- A consistent, premium visual identity for Remodius

- Base visuals designed intentionally for product integration

- A scalable AI workflow we can build on long-term





Success = volume + realism + brand consistency.



Brand Focus



- 
 (80%)

Adventurous remote professionals and digital nomads. Explorer / Creator energy.

Bold, modern, freedom-driven visuals. Travel + productivity blended.



- 
 (20%)

Wellness-focused home professionals.

Calm, minimal, reassuring, recovery-driven scenes.





What You’ll Do

- Generate ultra-realistic AI lifestyle scenes (indistinguishable from real photography)

- Create complete environments: models, lighting, styling, composition

- Design scenes intentionally for product insertion (shadow logic, perspective, spacing)

- Build structured, reusable asset batches — not random one-offs

- Document prompts & workflow in an organized way

- Collaborate closely with the founder and our core team (strategy, advertising & design partners)

- Deliver consistent output (?8 high-end assets per week)





Must-Haves

- Proven experience generating photorealistic human AI lifestyle scenes

- Strong control over lighting, anatomy, materials, perspective & realism

- Experience with modern AI image workflows (Midjourney, SDXL, ComfyUI, Runway, etc.)

- Ability to eliminate AI artifacts (hands, faces, skin texture, posture)

- Structured, repeatable workflow

- Fluent English

- Strong communication: clearly explains decisions (text + Loom)

- Output-driven mindset



Strong Plus

- Experience building visual assets for e-commerce brands

- Understanding of conversion-driven visual principles

- AI video generation experience

- Proactively proposing new visual concepts based on competitor research and emerging AI creative trends

- Brand-thinking mindset: confidently challenges and improves the brand story (the “why”)



Long-Term Opportunity



We are not looking for a short-term freelancer.



We are looking for someone to grow with us over the coming years.



This is a long-term collaboration with the opportunity to evolve into a deeper creative role — and potentially a full-time position (creative director) within our team.



If you want to build something long-term instead of jumping between projects, this is for you.





How To Apply (Hard Filter)



Send a 5–10 minute Loom video to 
 (camera on) answering:



1. Give a short introduction about yourself.

2. Show 3 examples of photorealistic human lifestyle scenes you created.

3. What AI tools do you use daily?

4. What makes AI images look fake — and how do you prevent that?

5. How would you design a scene meant for product insertion later?

6. How do you keep yourself up-to-date with design and AI trends?

7. What do you know about our company?

8. How do you approach competitor research and apply it in your work?

9. What are your core strengths?

10. What is your ideal work environment?



Send your loom video, resume and portfolio to 
 Applications without a Loom video will not be reviewed.



--------------



Location: Remote



Collaboration: Part-time (project-based) with long-term partnership intent. Potential to grow into a full-time role.



Salary: Monthly agreement based on experience, quality, and consistent delivery (~8 premium assets per week). Performance-based growth.



Start: ASAP



Looking forward to your application!

title: Eccommerce Manager
description:
We are seeking a true business owner in a management role, not an executor waiting for direction.



About Us

We are a Canadian manufacturer established in 1990. Our brands, Plastair, DeeVa, and PlastairFyre, are built on differentiated products, strong margins, and when appropriate, utility patents or design patents. We manufacture in Canada, or source electronics overseas, then protect and position them properly.



We have a strong presence in brick and mortar retail in North America for decades. Now we are building a serious digital revenue engine. Our online presence is underdeveloped relative to our product strength, and we want fast, measurable improvement without the owner being the day to day operator.



The Role



 - This is a full time leadership role for a true owner operator. You will own digital revenue results across Amazon Seller, Shopify DTC, and additional marketplaces including Walmart, Wayfair, and digital B2B platforms such as Faire and Grainger.



- This is not a VA role, not a coordinator role, not a task manager role. Your job is to build the machine, lead people, make decisions, and remove work from ownership’s plate.



- You will manage and leverage our existing Amazon operations resource, you will rebuild our creative production function to improve speed, accuracy, and quality.



What Success Looks Like:



Within 60 to 90 days, ownership should experience a real reduction in day to day decisions, fewer errors, faster execution, clearer reporting, and visible 
ntum across listings, creative, ads, and channel expansion.



If you do not remove work from the owner’s plate, you are not a fit.



Core Responsibilities:

-Digital revenue ownership and execution cadence



-Own the digital revenue plan, priorities, and weekly execution cadence across all digital channels



-Make decisions, do not push decisions upward unless budget risk or strategy change is required



-Implement a simple weekly reporting system showing revenue, margin, conversion, TACOS, ACOS, ROAS, inventory health, and next actions



-Marketplaces and Shopify DTC



-Own Amazon Seller growth, SKU focus, pricing strategy, merchandising, promotions, and catalog health



-Own Shopify DTC fundamentals, conversion rate improvement, product page quality, offers, and traffic plans



-Launch and scale Walmart and Wayfair with correct catalog setup, content requirements, compliance, and fulfillment workflows



-Plan and execute international Amazon expansion when unit economics and operational readiness support it



-Digital B2B marketplaces



-Own digital B2B marketplace performance including platforms such as Faire and Grainger



-Ensure pricing, content, and inventory strategy align with brand positioning and avoid channel conflict



-Coordinate onboarding, catalog setup, and ongoing optimization for digital wholesale platforms



-Paid media strategy and performance



-Own paid media strategy and budget allocation across Amazon ads and Meta, plus other channels as appropriate



-You may execute ads yourself or manage a specialist, but you are accountable for outcomes



-Build repeatable testing systems for keywords, creative, offers, and landing pages, not random changes



-Creative, content, and influencer systems



-Rebuild our creative production to improve speed, accuracy, and taste



-Create a repeatable workflow for product images, video, A plus content, storefronts, and ad creative



-Build an influencer and UGC pipeline that produces usable assets and measurable performance, not vanity metrics



Team leadership and accountability



-Manage Amazon Operations Lead, inventory, listings execution, and operational hygiene



-Hire and manage the minimum team needed to win, typically 2 to 4 people across ads execution and creative production



B-uild SOPs so performance does not depend on any one person



What We Already Have:



S-trong product differentiation, IP strategy, and manufacturing capability



-Existing Amazon operations support, currently part time



-Clear need to rebuild creative production due to speed and error issues



Required Experience and Traits:



-Proven ownership of ecommerce growth and results, not just tasks



-Experience managing Amazon Seller Central and at least two of the following, Shopify DTC, Walmart, Wayfair, Faire, Grainger



-Demonstrated leadership, hiring, training, accountability, and building repeatable systems



-Strong analytical thinking, comfortable with margin math and channel tradeoffs



-High urgency, fast execution, high quality, low error tolerance



-Fluent English, able to overlap 2 to 3 hours daily with Eastern Time



-Full time commitment to one company and long term mindset



Performance Targets:



-Targets will be confirmed after your initial audit, but you should expect accountability for:



-Meaningful growth from the current Amazon baseline while protecting contribution margin



-Clean scalable paid media performance with controlled ACOS and improving TACOS over time



-Walmart and Wayfair live with correct catalog, operational workflows, and launch plan



-Clear improvement in listing quality, creative quality, and production speed



-Digital B2B marketplace launches and optimization without channel conflict



-International expansion roadmap for at least one additional Amazon region when economics support it



How to Apply:



Submit all items to be prioritized.



-Your resume



A 200 word plan for your first 90 days, specific to Plastair, DeeVa, and PlastairFyre, generic plans will be rejected



-Links to brands, stores, or campaigns you directly managed, include specific results such as revenue impact, ACOS, TACOS, ROAS, conversion, growth rate



Optional, a 2 to 3 minute Loom video introducing yourself and explaining one case study win



Screening Note



We prioritize candidates who demonstrate ownership, decision making, and evidence of removing work from founders, not candidates who list tools and tasks.

title: Remote Wix Website Builder & SEO/SEM Specialist (Part-Time Contractor)
description:
Job Title: Remote Wix Website Builder & SEO/SEM Specialist (Part-Time Contractor)

Location: 100% Remote (Philippines-based applicants preferred)

Company: California-based FMS (Focused on becoming #1 globally in attracting product inquiries through optimized digital presence)

Job Type: Independent Contractor (Hourly billing via PayPal, Wise, or similar)

Schedule: 5 hours per day, Monday through Friday (approximately 25 hours per week)



Must overlap with US Pacific Standard Time (PST) business hours (e.g., 8 AM – 5 PM PST for collaboration; night shift in PH time ideal, as 10 AM PH = 6 PM previous day PST).



Compensation: $6–$10 USD per hour (based on experience and certifications; typical for experienced PH-based talent in this role). Paid weekly or bi-weekly. Negotiable for top candidates with proven results in driving global inquiries.

About the Role

FMS is a dynamic California company dedicated to leading the market in global product inquiries. We're seeking a skilled, certified Wix specialist with expertise in SEO and search engine marketing (SEM) to build, optimize, and maintain our websites remotely on a part-time basis. Your work will directly contribute to enhancing our online visibility, attracting international traffic, and positioning FMS as the top choice for product inquiries worldwide. This role may expand if performance excels.

Key Responsibilities



Design, build, and customize responsive websites using Wix platform, ensuring user-friendly navigation, mobile optimization, and integration of e-commerce or inquiry forms.

Implement on-page and off-page SEO strategies to improve search rankings, including keyword research, content optimization, meta tags, alt text, and site speed enhancements.

Manage SEM campaigns (e.g., Google Ads, paid search) to drive targeted global traffic and product inquiries, including ad creation, bidding, A/B testing, and performance tracking.

Analyze website performance using tools like Google Analytics and Search Console to identify opportunities for increasing inquiries from diverse global markets.

Perform regular site audits, updates, and maintenance to ensure SEO/SEM best practices are applied for maximum visibility and conversion.

Collaborate remotely with the team (via Slack, Zoom,
) to align on goals, report on metrics (e.g., traffic growth, inquiry rates), and suggest improvements for global reach.

Focus on strategies that attract international audiences, such as multilingual SEO elements or region-specific targeting to make FMS #1 in product inquiries.



Requirements



3+ years of experience building and managing websites on Wix, with a portfolio of live sites demonstrating SEO/SEM integration.

Proven track record in driving traffic and inquiries through SEO and paid search for global audiences.

Strong understanding of search engine algorithms, digital marketing trends, and tools like Google Analytics, Google Search Console, SEMrush, Ahrefs, or similar.

Excellent English communication skills (written and verbal) for professional reports and team interactions.

Reliable high-speed internet, quiet workspace, and flexibility for PST hours.

Ability to work independently as a remote contractor.



Required Certifications/Training

To ensure high-quality, professional work aligned with industry standards:



Wix-Specific: Wix Certified (e.g., Wix Partner Certification, Wix Web Designer Certification, or completion of Wix's official training courses on website building and SEO via Wix Learn).

SEO: Google Analytics Certification (Google Skillshop), SEMrush SEO Fundamentals Certification, HubSpot SEO Certification, or Ahrefs SEO Training Course.

SEM (Search Engine Marketing): Google Ads Certification (Search, Display, or Performance Max tracks via Google Skillshop), Microsoft Advertising Certified Professional, or equivalent paid search training from platforms like Udemy or Coursera.

These certifications demonstrate expertise and are essential for optimizing FMS's global inquiry strategy.



Preferred (Big Plus)



Experience with additional tools (e.g., Google Tag Manager, Hotjar for user behavior, Canva for visuals, or
 marketing platforms like Mailchimp).

Background in e-commerce or lead generation sites, with examples of increasing global inquiries.

Familiarity with international SEO (e.g., hreflang tags, geo-targeting).



How to Apply

Submit:



Resume/CV with Wix/SEO/SEM experience and certifications listed.

Portfolio links to Wix sites you've built/optimized, including before-after metrics on traffic/inquiries if available.

Expected hourly rate in USD.

Brief note on your PST availability and how you've driven global product inquiries in past roles.



We'll review quickly and may include a short Wix/SEO skills test. Join us in making FMS the global leader in product inquiries!

title: Revenue Operations Manager (Business Development)
description:
Summary

Revenue Operations Manager (Real Estate Coaching & Deals)



Budget: $1,500–$3,000/month + performance bonuses

Hours: 30–40 hrs/week

Location: Remote

Start: Immediate (paid trial)



Who This Role Is For



I run a real estate investing & coaching business that generates leads daily, runs live trainings, closes consulting/coaching clients, and works active real estate deals.



I am looking for a Revenue Operations Manager — not a VA.



This person’s job is simple:



Make sure revenue-producing activity happens every single day and nothing that can produce money gets dropped.



If you are comfortable pushing people for decisions, tracking pipelines, and holding sales activity accountable — this role is for you.



If you only like “tasks” and not ownership, this is not for you.



What You Will Own



You will own all revenue-related pipelines, including:



Coaching & consulting leads



Follow-up on sales calls



Deal pipelines (wholesale / flips)



Invoicing, deposits, and collections



Scheduling & confirming sales calls



Ensuring prospects move to a YES or NO



Your success is measured by:



Follow-ups completed



Calls booked & confirmed



Deals moved forward



Money collected



Daily Responsibilities



Review all active leads & opportunities daily



Ensure every lead is contacted & followed up



Push prospects to make decisions



Track deal progress & next actions



Coordinate contracts, invoices, and deposits



Update CRM & pipeline dashboards



Provide daily revenue updates (EOD summary)



Required Experience



2+ years in operations, sales support, or transaction coordination



Experience working with:



CRMs (GoHighLevel preferred)



Sales pipelines



Real estate or high-ticket services (strong plus)



Comfortable:



Following up persistently



Asking for money



Enforcing timelines



Holding others accountable



Personality Fit (Non-Negotiable)



You must:



Be proactive (not reactive)



Be direct and confident



Like closing open loops



Be calm under pressure



Care about results, not excuses



Compensation



Monthly base pay



Performance bonuses tied to:



Deals closed



Clients onboarded



Revenue collected



Top performers will earn more and grow into a long-term leadership role.



Trial Period



This role starts with a paid trial where you will work on:

Real revenue movement



Only candidates who perform in real conditions will be offered a long-term role.



How to Apply



In your application, include:

The word “REVENUE” at the top of your application
