title: YouTube Video Editor (Long-form)
description:
[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract

You may choose either Part-time(+3hrs/day) or Full-time



[Caution]

You’ll be using plugins in After Effects for motion and transitions, so please continue only if you’re already comfortable and experienced working in After Effects.



[Salary]

-$100 per project

-$300 USD commitment bonus after completing 10 projects (you will be paid $100+$300 for every 10th project you complete)

-You don't have to search for the visual elements such as video clips, images, talking-heads since all the elements will be provided.

-I can provide 1~2 projects each week as long as you can manage (our current editor says he can consistently handle around 1.5–2 projects per week after being fully aligned with the workflow and preferred style).

-Expect the first project will take longer as we need to adjust to the desired working style. But as we get on to the 2nd, 3rd, ... it will take less time as there will be less corrections to make.



[What You’ll Do]

IMPORTANT-> Here's a sample video(you must watch it before applying): 

-All the ingredients(images, video clips, voice-over, talking-head, BGM and script) for the video will be provided.

-You will select images that best match the context from the provided asset folder, place them at the appropriate timestamps, and add motion, transitions, sound effects, and background music.

-Use After Effect plugins such as Mister Horse and Flow to add dynamic motions.

-The images or video clips must match with what's being spoken by the voice-over.

-Collaborate with me or our team to ensure the visuals meet aesthetic and desired output.



*In the beginning, your edits will get a few rounds of feedback for refinement while adjusting to the preferred video style. But as you're aligned and become familiar, you won't need my feedback and refinement as much.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:

-Communicates effectively and values mutual respect.

-Has a creative editing skill for visually appealing videos; to avoid viewer's boredom.

-Has strong time management skills to meet deadlines.

-Is accountable and committed to the role.



*Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean?

Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know why and when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays. 

In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]

-Flexible hours to suit your schedule. (You’re welcome to work at night and submit your draft. While you’re asleep, it will be reviewed and feedback will be ready within 12 hours.)

-Long-term growth opportunities as the channel expands.

-A supportive environment that values creativity and contributions.



[About Us]

We help YouTube creators master storytelling techniques to captivate audiences and achieve viral success. Your role will play a key part in bringing our vision to life and empowering creators worldwide.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with “VIDEO EDIT”, or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:

1. Portfolio: Share 2-3 of your best projects involving video editing with motion graphic.

2. Work History: Explain any experience or projects involving motion graphics or After Effects.

3. After Effects Skill: Please rate your After Effects skill level on a 5-star scale.

4. Available Hours: Let us know when you are available for our work each day of the week(For example:Monday: 11:00AM - 2:00PM, Tuesday: 3:30PM - 8:00PM, Wednesday: ..., etc)

5. Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with this job. We'd prefer at least 3 months with additional projects forward.

6. Whether or not you're willing to be on a Zoo
eting: We prefer Zoo
eting because this shows your accountability as well as it drives our team to the same goal together.



I will respond to your application in 7 days all at once.

title: Community Moderator
description:
[Caution]

If you are a naturally empathetic and observant person who thrives on fostering positive online spaces, this role is a perfect fit.

This position requires high emotional intelligence, excellent communication skills, a genuine desire to help others, and the ability to be the eyes, ears, and heart of our online community. You will be a guardian of our culture, nurturing a safe and welcoming environment for all members.

If you view moderation as simply deleting posts and banning users without understanding the context or human element, this role may be a challenge for you.

So only read further if you’re passionate about building vibrant online communities, resolving conflicts with tact, and making every user feel heard and valued (ideally with a self-assessed ability level of 4.5 out of 5 stars or higher).



[Job Title]

Community Moderator VA (Community Health & Engagement)



[Work Type]

Remote | Flexible Hours | Long-term Contract



[Base Payment]

We offer a project-based compensation structure for those who apply as part-time. That said, the expected monthly range is USD $500–$800(for full-time workers), depending on factors such as proficiency, workload, task complexity, performance (including bonuses), experience, skill set, and the final scope of responsibilities.



[Bonus]

There's potential for a performance-based bonus tied to community health and engagement. Metrics could include positive sentiment scores, user engagement rates, and response time targets. We'll go over those details once you've demonstrated your skills, but you should be comfortable working with just the base pay initially.



[What You’ll Be Doing]



Your role is to be the supportive and vigilant heart of our online community and social media channels (YouTube, Instagram,
,
, etc.). You will be responsible for creating a thriving environment where our members feel safe, supported, and engaged. Your main tasks will include:



a) Proactive Community Monitoring: Actively scan our community platforms and social media for all posts and comments to ensure they adhere to our guidelines. You'll be responsible for identifying and encouraging positive contributions to nurture a healthy culture.



b) Reactive Moderation & Conflict Resolution: Promptly and fairly deal with flagged content, user reports, and disputes according to our rule-book. You will step in with diplomacy to de-escalate tensions and guide conversations toward a constructive resolution.



c) Managing User Messaging & Chat Support: Handle direct inquiries, concerns, and support requests that come through private messages and chat, maintaining a prompt, helpful, and on-brand tone.



d) Handling
 Support Inquiries: Manage our support inbox by categorizing, prioritizing, and responding to user questions. You will be responsible for escalating technical issues to the appropriate tea
mber when necessary.



e) Developing and Maintaining a Knowledge Base: Based on recurring questions from the community, you will create, update, and maintain a clear and simple FAQ/Knowledge Base section to help users find answers quickly.



f) Gathering and Reporting Community Feedback: Identify trends, common feature requests, and the overall sentiment of the community. You will provide concise, actionable reports that distinguish constructive feedback from general noise.



[Goal]

The ultimate goal is to build a vibrant, safe, and supportive online community. By championing our guidelines, fostering positive engagement, and providing outstanding support, you will ensure our members feel valued, respected, and eager to participate. You will be the engine of our positive and welcoming community culture.



[What We’re Looking For]

The ideal candidate:



a) Has Proven Community Moderation Experience: You have a strong track record of managing or moderating online communities (e.g., on 
,
 Groups, forums, or social media), with examples or references that speak to your skills.



b) Possesses High Emotional Intelligence: You are empathetic, patient, and skilled at navigating social dynamics online. You can de-escalate conflict, communicate with tact, and understand different user perspectives.



c) Is an Organized and Proactive Communicator: You are meticulous in tracking user inquiries and clear in your written communication. You don't just wait for problems; you actively monitor for potential issues.



d) Has a "Guardian of the Community" Mentality: You see your role as a protector of the community culture and a champion for its members, not just an enforcer of rules.



e) Is Proficient with Social Media & Community Platforms: You are skilled in using platforms such as 
,
, Instagram,
, etc., and are comfortable with helpdesk or ticketing software.



f) Communicates with Clarity and Values Respect: You are reliable, accountable, and can articulate your thoughts in a clear, logical manner.



Important Note:

We value respectful communication. What does it mean?

Most importantly, if you need to step away, just let me or your manager know why and when. We understand it, even if you need to leave tomorrow, BUT ghosting is the last thing you'd like to do, since it causes confusion and delays.

In everyday conversations, our team thrives on mutual respect, no matter your role.



[Why Work With Us?]



Flexible hours to suit your lifestyle.



The opportunity to be the voice and heart of a growing, people-first online community.



Long-term growth opportunities as our company scales.



A supportive environment where your communication skills and emotional intelligence are highly valued.



[About Us]

We are a growing team that believes our community is the cornerstone of our success. We are dedicated to creating an online space that is not only informative and engaging but also genuinely supportive and welcoming. Your role is absolutely critical to making that belief a reality.



[How to Apply]

Subject Line: Start your title with "Community Guardian", or your application can't be considered.



In your application, include:



1) Work History: Share your resume, focusing on your experience in community moderation, customer support, or social media management.



2) Moderation Challenge: What were the 3 most common or serious issues your previous community held, and how did you or your team resolve it. What was the lesson you learned? I'd like to hear the back-end story.



3) All moderation work has its emotional toll. Describe the specific type of user behavior or community conflict that you personally find the most emotionally draining to handle, and be honest about why it gets to you. More importantly, what specific, practical strategies have you developed to protect your own mental well-being and maintain objectivity when you have to deal with that exact situation?



4) Handling a Delicate Situation: You notice a long-time, valuable community member has started making passive-aggressive comments that are discouraging new members but don't explicitly break any major rules. How would you handle this situation privately and publicly to protect the community's welcoming atmosphere without alienating the long-time member?



5) Preferred Tool Stack: What are your go-to tools for social media management, community monitoring, or customer support? Please mention why you prefer them.



6) AI in Your Workflow: Explain where and how you might use AI to improve your productivity, and where you believe a human touch is required while using AI tools in community management.



7) Available Hours: Let us know your general availability (e.g., "Approximately 20 hours per week, mostly flexible between 1PM - 8PM on Monday, 3 PM - 10PM on Tuesday, 12PM - 8PM on Wednesday, ...,  in Philippines time").



8) Available Period of Work: Let us know for how long you expect to work with this job. We'd prefer at least 6 months with opportunities for extension.



9) Willingness for Zoo
etings: Confirm that you're willing to participate in occasional Zoo
etings for team alignment and check-ins.



I will respond to your application in 7-15 days all at once.

We look forward to hearing from you.
